Your donation gives you access to some very exclusive perks, in the form of limited edition prints by Akeelah Bertram not yet available for sale! These beautiful photographs capture an intricate light refraction from her previous work Vase, and a stunning visual of Converger - an object from the Ultiverse.
If the goal is not achieved, funds raised will still be used to amend the floor, but to a less effective quality.

Fragment, Chroma Print, 2013 from the installation Vase, 2013
 

Converger, Chroma Print, 2015 from the installation Ultiverse
 

Other ways you can help
Thank you so much for taking an interest in the project, if you're unable to help this time round please spread the word to friends who may be interested using the Indiegogo share tools
See you in the Ultiverse!

story:
M. Charlene Stevens - Founding Editor/ Publisher

Kimberly Light - Creative Director

Arcade Project zine is a forum for visual artists, performing artists and writers. The publication focuses its lens on contemporary art and culture, exploring each theme in thought-provoking images and text. 

Walter Benjamin’s, The Arcades Project inspired postmodernism and zine culture. The punk DIY, cut-and-paste zine, born in the 1970’s and reborn in the 1990’s remains alive and well as a culture, growing in strength and popularity by the work of artists and writers with an independent spirit. These publications are created and nurtured by those who do not wait for mainstream recognition, whose work demands to be seen and voices demand to be heard in the present.

Arcade Project publishes a variety of voices from different generations, locations and backgrounds. The zine discusses the works of established artists while giving space to emerging talent. Arcade Project zine welcomes the voices of academics, pop culture critics, poets, playwrights, bloggers, activists, storytellers and more.

Issue 1 -- explores sex, love, sexuality, gender. 

Contributors:

Katherine Battista, Kelly Blunt, Christoph Carr, John Connelly, Jamie Frey, Anne-Marie Levine, Kimberly Light, Linka Odom, Nina Puro, Anne Rishon, Foxy Squire, Christopher Sullivan, Bill Swayze

Studio Visits: 

Chris Bors, Michael Scoggins

Funding Breakdown:

Arcade Project zine needs to raise $3000 to launch. The cost of offset printing on recycled paper with soy ink is $2000. We hope to create a high quality, collectible object.  We hope to print a publication with beautiful and/or interesting images and engaging writing. The startup costs at $1000 include software, legal fees, freelance artists and designers and shipping. 

(Photo courtesy of Michael Scoggins and Victori + Mo Gallery)

story:
Hi I’m Alyson Baker, Please allow me  to take this opportunity to introduce you to “Urban Success Movement's - Worldhits.org", an answer to providing  technology, multimedia access and online training in poverty stricken areas. 

The objective is to provide online career awareness and eLearning that will help prepare students living in poverty for careers in digital media and work as independent professionals, in an atmosphere of innovation, leadership, teamwork, and creative thinking. 

We can no longer sit back and wait for elected officials to enact common sense reforms. 

At a young age I embraced learning and helping others, that's the reason I became a teacher. I want to leave a legacy of helping under-served youth gain skills that will give them a competitive edge in the 21st Century.

As a former teacher that grew up in Sarasota, FL. I know first hand that teaching is not easy. All too often educators are asked to achieve high goals with meager resources and distracted students. Technology alone can not improve learning, but an intimate partnership between educators, creative talent and technology developers can.

Worldhits.org, is a Social Network uniquely suited to the needs of creative Urban High School and College students who are accustomed to turning to social media for entertainment, communication, self-expression, gaining and sharing knowledge in addition to building interpersonal networks. Worldhits.org will include an eLearning component, a  social community (similar to other social media applications), and an online annual spoken-word/songwriter competition. Worldhits.Org has recently completed it’s test/proof of concept phase. As of August 1, 2015 we have more than 11,000 active members.






Over the last three years the number of teenagers using Facebook has declined by 25 percent, while the number of users 55 and older has gone up more than 80 percent. Many high school and college students are tired of using a social network where their parents, grandparents and future employers can see their updates. Enter Worldhits.Org, a social network designed with urban students in mind. The plan is to redesign Worldhits.Org to become more of a Multimedia social community and eLearning network with additional interactive features:  Songwriting, Spoken Word and Story telling competitions, as well as an Online Neighborhood Talk Video (ONTV) series called "Bridging The Abyss".




Worldhits.org is a membership based social community that is being redesigned to advance teenage digital communications and learning beyond the academic world. "Bridging The Abyss" ONTV series is an answer to the need for youth in disadvantaged communities to learn to use the worldwide web and social media to it's full potential, not just for recreation. Students will be encouraged to produce and distribute content on world views, while being mentored by professionals in the field.

Worldhits.org will relaunch with a national talent search and feature open auditions for "Bridging The Abyss" - I Can Change the World (#ICCTW) Challenge. #ICCTW CHALLENGE is a competition for voices of change (protest) Songwriters and Spoken Word Poets to promote civic engagement. The desired outcome is to build bridges between races and generations via audio and video communications. Youth will have an opportunity to voice their emotions surrounding the  social injustices and atrocities occurring today.

Marvin Gay, John Lennon and Bob Marley were the hip, counter-cultural voices of their generation. Today we are seeing a revival of the protest song in pop and alternative music evolving into an international movement giving voice to the voiceless, focusing specifically on teens.

We can start here, by creating a safe platform for all young poets and protest songwriters to speak their minds, while maintaining responsibility for every syllable.

 This is our way of letting teens "Get it off their Chest." It’s about engaging a world audience. Through our online social and learning network we can begin to make social change.

The meaning of “Protest Song” is broad – Kanye West rapped about child labor in “Diamonds From Sierra Leon” and Public Enemy performed political music in the late 80’s. The song “Fight The Power” was conceived at the request of film director Spike Lee, who sought a musical theme for his 1989 film “Do the Right Thing.” 

 Several groups of poets and musicians arose from the late 1960s African-American civil rights movement.  “Serious spokesmen like Gill Scott-Heron, The Last Poets, and later Gary Byrd, who paved the way for the many socially committed Black Emcees a decade later.”


Virtual mentors will encourage young songwriters and poets to write pieces for "Bridging The Abyss" ONTV series and even short films that go along with their song or spoken word entries. We believe that the racial and politically-charged tension caused by recent events in this country and around the world have reignited  this genre of music. 

I want youth to share their thoughts from a social or personal experience through music and skits. The #ICCTW Challenge is an opportunity for amateur composers to showcase their talent on "Bridging The Abyss" ONTV series and to inspire all of us to take an active role in making our community and the world a better place.

Worldhits.org is a social platform that takes community issues, concerns and experiences and makes them a part of teenagers education, social and political life.

I think it's a great idea to engage Urban youth in creating social networks, online contests, audio and video content with the intent to educate and entertain.

This platform gives  youth the freedom to speak out, be heard and counted in protests and exercise their voting power through text messaging, podcasting, videos and blogs without the risk associated with mass public demonstrations.

One of the many eLearning classes that Worldhits.org will host, is "Writing to the Senses," a creative writing workshop run by Nathan Ross Freeman, Creative Director of Authoring Action. Nathan has initiated many literary events including open mic and writing retreats; providing opportunities for songwriters to collaborate and network. 


What I Need

 It hasn't been easy to get this far during the initial development phase.  Despite the progress made over the past three years, there is still a lot of work to do. With your help, I hope to raise $15,000 for the next phase of development which includes: Involving the Silicon Valley Community Foundation (SVCF) in the strategic planning, website development and the creation and management of a Charitable fund.  I would also like  to give youth that are learning to code an opportunity to work as virtual volunteers and/or interns under the guidance of Silicon Valley Community Foundation on developing mobile Apps and the redesign and relaunching of Worldhits.org.


SVCF's customized philanthropy team will be contracted to develop the initial strategic planning around the full scope of what I am trying to accomplish.

The redesigned website will include these additional features and more:

*Donation page for U.S.A. 4 TECH fund (coming soon!)

*eLearning  capacity

*Virtual mentors and tutors

*Artist can get feedback on their original music/spoken word from professionals and other members.

*Multimedia project promotion and distribution services

*Chapter development


The Impact

Now, more than ever, major corporations and foundations are aligning with celebrities, public figures, community leaders and non-profit organizations for a good cause. However, the dynamic between nonprofits and private sector organizations has shifted in corporate philanthropy, from giving programs to strategic investments. This requires a more innovative business approach like ours for fundability and sustainability.


The US Movement is designed to significantly broaden collaborations among celebrities, public figures, corporations, foundations, community based organizations, schools and colleges. The result will be sponsorship and/or promotion of the #ICCTW Challenge in support of education reform, Internet access, career awareness, entrepreneurial literacy, as well as creating a virtual entrepreneurial future workforce.


Worldhits.org provides a "home" and a family, for young music lovers, songwriters, poets and composers through our programs, resources, community network and support.

Youth will have hands on experiences in creative writing, developing websites, graphic design, content management and social media marketing.

Worldhits.org provides artist and music lovers opportunities to collaborate, create awareness about their original music, promote themselves and get training. The plan is to team up with Silicon Valley Foundation, publishing companies, entertainment venues, producers, schools, the wider media and other like-minded individuals to create a chain of support and networking opportunities.


Risks & Challenges

Social Networks are a dime a dozen. There are plenty out there, each with specific roles and high competition. My main obstacle would be getting the word out to the Urban Community that this social platform is filled with not only the familiar components of social media, but also new and unique user experiences made possible by features that we are implementing into the website.

The challenges are real – production and content is one of those challenges. The overall features that I want to present to our users will definitely be time consuming, but I plan to work long hours, even if it means producing most of the core content myself. 


Other Ways You Can Help

The Worldwide web is the new frontier where we can stake a claim to virtual real-estate. By sharing this crowdfunding effort, by joining worldhits.org's membership and creating your profile on the site, as well as encouraging others to do the same, you are helping to support the development of a new student lead online social community. I am especially reaching out to my family, friends, Sororities, Fraternities and Members of the Entertainment Industry;  together we can create, encourage, support, promote and grow innovative projects for social change.

I truly believe in the power of Good Music, the World-Wide web,  social media marketing and above all, collective action. This is your chance to be the Change you want to see in the World!





This entry called Race Relations from Winston-Salem, North Carolina is in memory of those who lost their lives in South Carolina and the many others before and after them!


Here is a sneak peek of Authoring Action participants rehearsing at my studio in North Carolina for #ICCTW Challenge. The song is taking shape with its catchy tune and lyrics. Can't wait to hear the finished product. Let the Challenge begin!

story:
**UPDATE FEB/2016** Anyone looking to donate still can do so even though the campaign has ended.  If you want to donate and still get a Perk below you can email me at seethechange1t@gmail.com with the details.  If not the donate button is up at: http://burnfund.org/burn-fund-centre-2-2/ Thank you everyone for your amazing support, The Centre Grand Opening is Mar.18th 2016!!


The Burn Fund Centre Legacy Project

                          Giving Survivors the Best Chance at Recovery

An extraordinary opportunity to build a new & permanent home comes but once in a lifetime for a charity.  This is our time!  The Burn Fund Centre will be a permanent home to meet a critical shortfall in accommodations for burn & trauma patients and their family caregivers. 


WE are the Burn Fund


We are the BC Professional Fire Fighters’ Burn Fund, the registered charity of the BC Professional Fire Fighters' Association. An organization supported by over 3900 Professional Fire Fighters. The Burn Fund is dedicated to promoting burn prevention, providing survivor support and recovery programs in the province of British Columbia and the Yukon.

About the Burn Fund 

We are dedicated and committed to;

  • Burn Prevention & Education 
  • Child & Adult Burn Survivor Support & Recovery Programs
  • Purchase of Burn Treatment Equipment - Provincial Benefit
  • Supporting Medical Staff Education 
  • Children's Burn Survivor Camp in BC (Burn Camp)
  • Burn & Wound Healing Research Lab directed by Dr. Aziz Ghahary
  • Building a new Burn Fund Centre, our biggest and most ambitious project to date. A true legacy to Burn Survivors and their compassionate future care

WHAT is the Burn Fund Centre Legacy Project?

One of the newest and most exciting projects we have underway is the Burn Fund Centre - our new and permanent  ' home-away-from home' for Burn Survivors and their families.  The Centre's construction is almost complete with a projected grand opening in March 2016. The vision for the Burn Fund Centre started over 10 years ago. Within the last year, it has become a reality because of all the generosity, hard work and dedication of everyone involved. We are so close to completion!

     Dream to Reality; the finish line is within reach!

(photo of front of Burn Fund Centre on Main St. Nov.2015, almost completed and ready to open in March 2016! - credit Allan de la Plante)

WHY Build a Burn Fund Centre?

  • The Burn Fund Centre will address the critical short fall in patient accommodations for Burn Survivors and their families. 
  • The Burn Fund Centre will ensure families stay together during prolonged treatment.
  • Uninterrupted treatment in a home-away-form-home atmosphere speeds successful long-term recovery, especially for children. 
  • The Centre is located on the corner of Main and 23rd Street in between and close to Vancouver General Hospital and Children's Hospital burn units.

(photo of side of Burn Fund Centre on 23rd St. Nov.2015 - credit Allan de la Plante)


WHO Needs the Burn Fund Centre?

  • Burn and major trauma survivors from across BC and the Yukon, who travel to Vancouver under emergency circumstances for medical treatment
  • Survivors who need on-going treatment such as burn dressings, skin grafts, pressure garments, plastic and reconstructive surgery, trauma counselling and physiotherapy
  • The minimum average stay is 10 days but can last many weeks or months, with follow up treatments and outpatient care that could last years.  As child and adult Burn Survivors come back for repeated care, the Burn Fund Centre will become this key missing piece for families needing accommodations during this challenging time. 


We are close to Children's Hospital for Child Burn Survivors and their families.


"I was nine years old... I was a patient for almost two months... my family could not always be there with me, which is why the new Burn Centre that is being planned is so important for families like mine."                                                                                                     ~ Rhea Dyck, Burn Survivor 


We are close to Vancouver General Hospital for Adult Burn Survivors and their families.

 

 "I endured more than twenty surgeries that year.                                                                       I spent seven months in the burn unit."                                                                                     ~ Heidi Cave, Burn Survivor and Author      www.heidicave.com 


Let's Look Inside The Burn Fund Centre

  • 8 short-term-stay, FREE of charge, furnished accommodation suites for patients and families while undergoing treatment at VGH or Children’s Hospital, on discharge transition or returning for follow up appointments
  • Common spaces for all guests; a family friendly great room, children’s play area, large family kitchen, laundry facilities, computer stations, resource and games library, secure outdoor spaces, and healing garden with plants chosen for their burn injury-friendly qualities
  • Information, Referrals & Subsidies for Child, Youth & Adult Burn Survivors
  • “Future Is Mine”—Adult Burn Survivor Program
  • Young Burn Survivor – Summer Camp
  • Burn & Safety Awareness Educational Resources & Programs
  • BC Professional Fire Fighters’ Burn Fund Administration Offices
  • Ground Floor includes 3,100 square feet of prime retail space—a social venture to support the building’s operations

        

(on the 2nd floor accommodations level this is the view from the large communal family kitchen with secure outdoor spaces, and healing garden with plants chosen for their burn injury-friendly qualities)

The generosity of individuals, companies, and foundations is crucial to the continued development and delivery of the more than thirty essential programs; including equipment purchases and support that is so desperately needed by burn survivors, their families, caregivers, and hospitals.

The Burn Fund Centre will bring all of this work together under one roof. 


HOW can you help with the Burn Fund Centre? 

Support for this project has been overwhelming and we are in the home stretch of our fundraising with only $440,000 CAD of $13.1M left to raise. We need to raise less than the last 4% to fully fund the Centre we are 96% there! This is our version of the Ronald McDonald house and will be the first facility of its kind in the WORLD for Burn Survivors and their families, so a truly historic opening!

1 - MAKE A DONATION TO THIS CAMPAIGN!

We are grateful for every donation we receive ,together we will reach this goal!

2 - GET INVOLVED - JOIN and SHARE this CAMPAIGN! 

Let's get this campaign out there and let's cross the finish line together!

www.burnfundcentre.org

#WeAreAllTheBurnFund 

twitter.com/burnfundcentre 

www.facebook.com/burnfundcentre

                                    

Exclusive Perks 

We have minimized Perks as we wish to encourage donations that will receive a charitable tax receipt.  Any donation level can be made with out a Perk if you desire as well.  Just let us know!  

1 - Any donation to our campaign starting at $25 gets our exclusive Noble Cause Filter! Thank you for your donation and promoting your support! 
(*charitable tax receipt available*)


2 - For $75 there are a SMALL NUMBER of Autographed books "Flame of Courage" by Allan de la Plante, photographer of the Wall on the side of the Burn Fund Centre Building! (personal dedication can be added!)


 3 - THE DONOR WALL AT THE BURN FUND CENTRE any donation starting at the $100 level (and up!) is eligible to have their name inscribed on our incredibly beautiful donor wall which will greet all those who enter into the Centre's new lobby.  There is no better way to enjoy the Legacy of the Burn Fund Centre than to visit and see your name on this amazing Donor Wall!                                            (*charitable tax receipt available*)


4 - ReFire clothing, bags, accessories handmade by Kelvin Cornelssen (local Fire Fighter - belts have been added!) 

www.refire.ca

         


For any friends using USD your donation is 33% more to the Burn Fund!!


           THANK YOU EVERYONE! 

                           The Burn Fund Centre  

       A Legacy for all the people of British Columbia & the Yukon.


To learn more watch our 'What Is The Burn Fund' short video.

Our heartfelt original PSA called 'What Is The Burn Fund?' will give you a quick overview of the core areas we focus on. The Burn Fund funds 6 major areas and set of programs, highlighted in this piece. The PSA ends with a piece on The Burn Fund Centre, which is the focus of this campaign!


(Jack and Darlene Poole and their foundation have given $2.5M to the Burn Fund Centre Building - Thank you so much for your Cornerstone Dedication!)


**Any donations beyond the $500K in 2015 will 100% go to The Burn Fund Centre's operating endowment, 100%!!  Few organizations can say this!! **
story_txt:
**UPDATE FEB/2016** Anyone looking to donate still can do so even though the campaign has ended.  If you want to donate and still get a Perk below you can email me at seethechange1t@gmail.com with the details.  If not the donate button is up at: http://burnfund.org/burn-fund-centre-2-2/ Thank you everyone for your amazing support, The Centre Grand Opening is Mar.18th 2016!!

The Burn Fund Centre Legacy Project
                          Giving Survivors the Best Chance at Recovery



An extraordinary opportunity to build a new & permanent home comes but once in a lifetime for a charity.  This is our time!  The Burn Fund Centre will be a permanent home to meet a critical shortfall in accommodations for burn & trauma patients and their family caregivers. 
WE are the Burn Fund

We are the BC Professional Fire Fighters’ Burn Fund, the registered charity of the BC Professional Fire Fighters' Association. An organization supported by over 3900 Professional Fire Fighters. The Burn Fund is dedicated to promoting burn prevention, providing survivor support and recovery programs in the province of British Columbia and the Yukon.



About the Burn Fund 
We are dedicated and committed to;

Burn Prevention & Education 
Child & Adult Burn Survivor Support & Recovery Programs
Purchase of Burn Treatment Equipment - Provincial Benefit
Supporting Medical Staff Education 
Children's Burn Survivor Camp in BC (Burn Camp)
Burn & Wound Healing Research Lab directed by Dr. Aziz Ghahary
Building a new Burn Fund Centre, our biggest and most ambitious project to date. A true legacy to Burn Survivors and their compassionate future care


WHAT is the Burn Fund Centre Legacy Project?

One of the newest and most exciting projects we have underway is the Burn Fund Centre - our new and permanent  ' home-away-from home' for Burn Survivors and their families.  The Centre's construction is almost complete with a projected grand opening in March 2016. The vision for the Burn Fund Centre started over 10 years ago. Within the last year, it has become a reality because of all the generosity, hard work and dedication of everyone involved. We are so close to completion!

     Dream to Reality; the finish line is within reach!


(photo of front of Burn Fund Centre on Main St. Nov.2015, almost completed and ready to open in March 2016! - credit Allan de la Plante)

WHY Build a Burn Fund Centre?



The Burn Fund Centre will address the critical short fall in patient accommodations for Burn Survivors and their families. 

The Burn Fund Centre will ensure families stay together during prolonged treatment.

Uninterrupted treatment in a home-away-form-home atmosphere speeds successful long-term recovery, especially for children. 
The Centre is located on the corner of Main and 23rd Street in between and close to Vancouver General Hospital and Children's Hospital burn units.



(photo of side of Burn Fund Centre on 23rd St. Nov.2015 - credit Allan de la Plante)





WHO Needs the Burn Fund Centre?



Burn and major trauma survivors from across BC and the Yukon, who travel to Vancouver under emergency circumstances for medical treatment
Survivors who need on-going treatment such as burn dressings, skin grafts, pressure garments, plastic and reconstructive surgery, trauma counselling and physiotherapy

The minimum average stay is 10 days but can last many weeks or months, with follow up treatments and outpatient care that could last years.  As child and adult Burn Survivors come back for repeated care, the Burn Fund Centre will become this key missing piece for families needing accommodations during this challenging time. 






We are close to Children's Hospital for Child Burn Survivors and their families.






"I was nine years old... I was a patient for almost two months... my family could not always be there with me, which is why the new Burn Centre that is being planned is so important for families like mine."                                                                                                     ~ Rhea Dyck, Burn Survivor 



We are close to Vancouver General Hospital for Adult Burn Survivors and their families.





 
 "I endured more than twenty surgeries that year.                                                                       I spent seven months in the burn unit."                                                                                     ~ Heidi Cave, Burn Survivor and Author      www.heidicave.com 





Let's Look Inside The Burn Fund Centre


8 short-term-stay, FREE of charge, furnished accommodation suites for patients and families while undergoing treatment at VGH or Children’s Hospital, on discharge transition or returning for follow up appointments
Common spaces for all guests; a family friendly great room, children’s play area, large family kitchen, laundry facilities, computer stations, resource and games library, secure outdoor spaces, and healing garden with plants chosen for their burn injury-friendly qualities
Information, Referrals & Subsidies for Child, Youth & Adult Burn Survivors
“Future Is Mine”—Adult Burn Survivor Program
Young Burn Survivor – Summer Camp
Burn & Safety Awareness Educational Resources & Programs
BC Professional Fire Fighters’ Burn Fund Administration Offices
Ground Floor includes 3,100 square feet of prime retail space—a social venture to support the building’s operations


        
(on the 2nd floor accommodations level this is the view from the large communal family kitchen with secure outdoor spaces, and healing garden with plants chosen for their burn injury-friendly qualities)
The generosity of individuals, companies, and foundations is crucial to the continued development and delivery of the more than thirty essential programs; including equipment purchases and support that is so desperately needed by burn survivors, their families, caregivers, and hospitals.The Burn Fund Centre will bring all of this work together under one roof. 


HOW can you help with the Burn Fund Centre? 
Support for this project has been overwhelming and we are in the home stretch of our fundraising with only $440,000 CAD of $13.1M left to raise. We need to raise less than the last 4% to fully fund the Centre we are 96% there! This is our version of the Ronald McDonald house and will be the first facility of its kind in the WORLD for Burn Survivors and their families, so a truly historic opening!

1 - MAKE A DONATION TO THIS CAMPAIGN!
We are grateful for every donation we receive ,together we will reach this goal!


2 - GET INVOLVED - JOIN and SHARE this CAMPAIGN! 
Let's get this campaign out there and let's cross the finish line together!
www.burnfundcentre.org


#WeAreAllTheBurnFund 

twitter.com/burnfundcentre 
www.facebook.com/burnfundcentre




                                    
Exclusive Perks 
We have minimized Perks as we wish to encourage donations that will receive a charitable tax receipt.  Any donation level can be made with out a Perk if you desire as well.  Just let us know!  


1 - Any donation to our campaign starting at $25 gets our exclusive Noble Cause Filter! Thank you for your donation and promoting your support! 
(*charitable tax receipt available*)





2 - For $75 there are a SMALL NUMBER of Autographed books "Flame of Courage" by Allan de la Plante, photographer of the Wall on the side of the Burn Fund Centre Building! (personal dedication can be added!)




 3 - THE DONOR WALL AT THE BURN FUND CENTRE any donation starting at the $100 level (and up!) is eligible to have their name inscribed on our incredibly beautiful donor wall which will greet all those who enter into the Centre's new lobby.  There is no better way to enjoy the Legacy of the Burn Fund Centre than to visit and see your name on this amazing Donor Wall!                                            (*charitable tax receipt available*)



4 - ReFire clothing, bags, accessories handmade by Kelvin Cornelssen (local Fire Fighter - belts have been added!) www.refire.ca

         



For any friends using USD your donation is 33% more to the Burn Fund!!





           THANK YOU EVERYONE! 

                           The Burn Fund Centre  

       A Legacy for all the people of British Columbia & the Yukon.






To learn more watch our 'What Is The Burn Fund' short video.
Our heartfelt original PSA called 'What Is The Burn Fund?' will give you a quick overview of the core areas we focus on. The Burn Fund funds 6 major areas and set of programs, highlighted in this piece. The PSA ends with a piece on The Burn Fund Centre, which is the focus of this campaign!






(Jack and Darlene Poole and their foundation have given $2.5M to the Burn Fund Centre Building - Thank you so much for your Cornerstone Dedication!)



**Any donations beyond the $500K in 2015 will 100% go to The Burn Fund Centre's operating endowment, 100%!!  Few organizations can say this!! **

story:
What is this project about?

I've always wanted to create a publication that is also art, a way to communicate ideas with images and text, and in the form of the thing itself. I imagined subscribers getting a package in the mail every few months, and opening it like a gift. I wanted it to be art that you can hold and touch and move.

So, I am publishing editions of artist's books. I call it The Metamer Quarterly -- I chose the equinoxes and solstices for shipping dates, and started selling subscriptions in 2016. Issue #3, "The Book of Love," will ship this month, around June 20th.

You could describe an artist's book as a book that is an art object. It borrows from the attributes of books – covers, hinges, pages, text – but also expands the idea of what a book can be. Artists' books don't reproduce art or images – they are the art. The subject is often reflected in how an artist's book is made, and what it is made of, as well as in text and image. 

This format gives me both license, and some challenging boundaries. Each issue strikes a balance between originality and the need for reproduction. I plan to continue to use manual forms of reproduction as much as possible, like screenprinting and letterpress, and to always include elements that are drawn, collaged, handmade, and unique to each copy in the edition. This project is analog; its design and purpose are about physicality, objects, feel, and weight. It is art you can hold in your hands.

The first issue, “Metamerism”, came out in December of 2016: an accordion book made with heavyweight drawing paper, gel transfers, paint, rubber stamps, and containing a real glass prism. The second issue, “Maps and Diagrams”, shipped in March. It is covered in a durable bookcloth used for library editions. Inside, a folder with a star-shaped opening holds soccer coaching diagrams, an airport map turned poem, the night sky in gold leaf, and maps of childhood. I had five collaborators on this issue, which was a real joy.

Why Do You Need Funding?

My first campaign was aimed at expanding my skills and materials. I raised enough money to take a week-long class at the North Bennet St School in June, and to invest in some additional tools and materials for the next six issues.

(If you would like to learn more, click here:  https://www.indiegogo.com/projects/the-metamer-...  )

This new, "Part Two" campaign has two main goals - expanding the audience and collectors, and taking the show on the road. As I've spread the word about this project, and some of the art projects that arose out of the perks, interest has grown. IndieGoGo provides a convenient way to meet some of the new demand. Additionally, a little more funding will allow me to visit some book fairs, and some of artist's book collections, particularly in Boston, New York, Philadelphia, and Chicago. I want to see and hold and study what other artists are doing!

What Do I Get In Return?

At every level, you will receive original art related to The Metamer Quarterly. Perks are set up to correspond to a particular donation amount; they include framable versions of art from the first two issues – a star map with gold leaf stars, and a color wheel in the medium of your choice.The higher levels include one or more issues of TMQ.

You will also get public thanks for your support  - everyone who contributes will be listed on a special Thank You  page on The Metamer Quarterly website/blog. I also plan to include the names of all the IndieGoGo supporters in Issue #3, "The Book of Love."

How Else Can I Help?

Spread the word! Please share this campaign with any friend or colleague who might be interested in the project. Feel free to share the link on social media, and please contact me if you'd like some art cards to hand out.

I consider it a help too if you are supporting the arts in any way, in any place. I'm very serious! I am an artist in part because my family had their friends' art on the walls, and took us to museums and live music events and dance performances. We need the arts, and all artists need audiences – go to a show, to a museum, to exhibitions at local galleries or at the library in town. Buy more art if you can!

By The Way, What Is A Metamer?

A metamer is a color that appears, to a particular observer, to be identical to another color in some lighting situations, but not in others. That shift from match to mis-match indicates a difference in chemical make-up and spectral reflectance – the colors' light signatures – and is called metamerism. Metamers only exists in relationship to each other, and depend on who is looking and under what conditions. I like that as a metaphor. You can't be a metamer by yourself.

Metamerism is something we experience visually all the time. It is the reason that a paint chip from the hardware store can match the living room wall at night but is glaringly off in daylight. It is the socks that matched when you put them on this morning, but didn't later at the office. All colors shift depending on light and juxtaposition; metamers perform a little dance with one another, joining and separating, meeting and diverging.

And, Who Are You Again?

My name is Lara Scott, and I am an artist currently living in Central New York -- south of Utica, north of Binghamton. I grew up in Stamford, CT, and got a BA in Art at Yale University, focusing on painting and printmaking. After college, I lived in DC, and drifted in the direction of art history for awhile. Then I drifted out to California. When I realized that no matter where I drifted, I was always making art, I decided to move in a more definite direction. I returned to the east coast, and got my MFA at the University of Pennsylvania. After that, I taught studio art at two small colleges, one near St Louis, MO, and the other in VA, for over seven years. Most recently, I worked in the R&D Lab at Golden Artist Colors, also for about seven years. I am now working primarily as freelance graphic designer and illustrator, something I've done off and on for the last twenty plus years.

I work primarily in collage, oil paint, and video. 

If you have any questions, please drop me a line. Email me at pantherBrown <at> mail.com, or write to Lara Scott, The Metamer Quarterly, P.O. Box 725, Sherburne, NY 13460.

story:
www.adriandiubaldo.com

Who I am

My name is Adrian DiUbaldo. My relationship with photography is not a very novel one. I didn't grow up with a camera constantly in my hands or by my side.  It started because I had a crush on a girl in the early years of college in Flagstaff, Arizona.  My pursuit, though not fruitful, uncovered an obsession with photography I did not expect to have.

I spent the remaining years of school constantly honing my skills and studying photojournalism as a profession.  I worked as a photojournalist from 2007-2010.  Then I began making imagery as a service for musicians and bands nationally and locally renown to Denver.  My company was called Photo Roadies. This company was successfully run until 2013, when new opportunities arose.

In 2013, I moved to Santa Barbara, California to study photography and art.  My understanding of photography and appreciation for artwork completely changed, as did I and what I create.  After nearly completing my MFA thesis at the Brooks Institute in Ventura California, the school closed its doors forever.  This was a sad occurrence indeed.

I am currently living in Colorado and continually exploring the transformative value of my art.  Most recently, I have been investigating Bipolar Disorder and the effect of mental illness on those closely connected to it.  By imbuing my work with discoveries about my own Bipolar Disorder, my goal is to contribute to the alleviation of any stigma associated with the illness. 

 

What I Need

Ok guys, here are the nuts and bolts.  Your support will go towards the renovation of my art space including the following:

a new photographic printer

dark room supplies

new brushes

fine art paper

a big batch of t-shirts to print on to support retail orders

a new camera

shelving

chemicals

paints

preferably an intern- to pay

a laptop

framing and packaging materials

 

How I Plan to Make a Difference

My art means a lot to me.  That is a cold hard truth for anyone who has found his or her artistry.  I want to press the point that I don’t just make art for myself, or monetary gain.  I have a life beyond my camera.  I am diagnosed Bipolar 1 mentally ill now for over 13 years. Since I picked up the camera my life and art have been twirling around this diagnosis.  In the last few years this twirl is more like a swirl.  They are blending into each other and they feed off of each other.  I get immense joy when I see someone truly connect to my artwork, and it gives me the power to spread that joy and knowledge to the community of mentally ill around me.  There are too many families that have been broken by a lack of affordable care, and there are too many with out homes because they are stuck in a destructive cycle of self-medication and oppression from the ignorant.  I spent years grappling with what it means for me to have this chronic disorder. Now that I know, I want to teach and share.  I just need the money to do it.  This is my dream, and this is where I start. With you.   

 

How You Can Help

You can help donating, duh.

You can help me by going to my website and reading about who I am. If you really like my work, buy some of my more expensive pieces of artwork.  If that is the case, then we get to become real friends.  I don’t let go of those supporters :)

You can help by supporting any family or friend that you know that has a mental illness.  Anything helps immensely.

You can help by spreading the word about my goals and campaign. As an individual, my audience is limited, but I hope to grow my community by tapping into yours with your support.

story:
The cropping on that image…amiright? 


Introducing: 'The Worst Coffee Table Book in History' 


The Campaign is Simple: I will make 'The Worst Coffee Table Book in History'. Each section of the 100+ page book will be infuriating to look at. From bad speling to horrible tattoos. This book will cover it all. 

The Perks are Simple: You can get your name in the book, get the book, or author a page in the book. 

The Funding is Simple: Funds from this project will support local art initiatives in San Diego. This art will help others appreciate how hard people work to make the world beautiful. 

The Delivery is Simple: 'The Worst Coffee Table Book in History' will be ready to ship in December 2015. Delivery will most likely be in February 2016. 

Who is the Author?: You are the Author, well not really, but you can claim to be. I don't mind. This book will be published anonymously, however, 15% of profits will be donated to support local art initiatives. #helpmefail

Support or don't support. I love you either way.

story:
*¡Videos work just keep on clicking!*


Rock bottom and on top of the world!

So if u stand at the opposite side of the globe it turns out you are actually on top of the world depending on your perspective.

I spent all my money down the pub having a whale of a time thinking about art, life and coincidence and now I have no money so Now ironically I'm back making art!!

So healed and cleaned I realize arts  an expensive game for sure…so it’s time to sell some resources I’ve been saving up for a while.

I made a book in 2009 and I’ve had it with me since showing of to random people I’ve met and generally connecting with strangers at a deep level within minuets as they read through the “book of love”.

With that landslide success I thought I’d put the love back out to pasture so you lot can have a good feed , and so can I!

The hard copy is available but it’s a bit pricey as it’s a vanity press online, here’s a private invite so you can have a butchers .. http://www.blurb.com/bookstore/invited/4994982/... 

But hey wait what do I get!? I hear you ask … Well what’s better than a really expensive real Life book..u guessed it a really affordable Christmas stocking filler in the form a universal E-Book. YAY! :)

A quick note to those who don’t know…this book really is a delight, everyones either enthralled by it or runs a mile, u will enjoy, faint and exam your own minds eyes as you read through is magical press… Fact :)

But you know I also have a load of other analytical skills that I have acquired over the years, from walking thousands of miles through a vision of flowing information and theoretical endeavors in the dead of winter and in the heat of the midday sun-shadows.

So with that In mind and the Internet doing live streaming what better time than to test out a theory of coincidence.

How it works is that at any given time or with a photo I will give my opinion on the given visual stimuli, so as the narration comes alive it will supply a direction or flow of energy, this can be used by the viewer to translate and question certain elements of their own lives that may bond with the the jackanory (story) for what is a language without spelling and spells!?

Sanity disclaimer..I’m no magician, seer or whichdoctor! but asking questions for development of self in my opinion can’t be all bad.

The actual connection of real life elements in real time has the power to prove quantum entanglement and could hold the possibility to connect to another dimension… Or maybe not, but let’s find out…

The rewards come in the form of a real life ebook, quantum consultations, and a load of odds and ends that I’ve picked up in my travels.

Apart from testing this quantum entanglement theory of coincidence, the money raised will fuel further art projects and a new book which of course you have first dibs on…

So yay for the Internet and yay for us…Happy Christmas and I hope enjoy all 228 pages of love :)xx

Ps I will give £2.5 to the crisis charity for refugees and at the moment the UK government will match that donation though gift aid.

So if u buy an ebook for £7.50, I get £5 the charity gets £2.5 from me and £2.5 from the government … So in the end I get £5 And the charity gets £5 and you get an ebook and u have doubled your donation to charity….everyone’s a winner…BONUS :)

Pps this offers on till Christmas so everyone gets their ebook for the 25th December ..

Chow now me old China :)
story_txt:
*¡Videos work just keep on clicking!*Rock bottom and on top of the world!So if u stand at the opposite side of the globe it turns out you are actually on top of the world depending on your perspective.I spent all my money down the pub having a whale of a time thinking about art, life and coincidence and now I have no money so Now ironically I'm back making art!!So healed and cleaned I realize arts  an expensive game for sure…so it’s time to sell some resources I’ve been saving up for a while.I made a book in 2009 and I’ve had it with me since showing of to random people I’ve met and generally connecting with strangers at a deep level within minuets as they read through the “book of love”.With that landslide success I thought I’d put the love back out to pasture so you lot can have a good feed , and so can I!The hard copy is available but it’s a bit pricey as it’s a vanity press online, here’s a private invite so you can have a butchers .. http://www.blurb.com/bookstore/invited/4994982/... But hey wait what do I get!? I hear you ask … Well what’s better than a really expensive real Life book..u guessed it a really affordable Christmas stocking filler in the form a universal E-Book. YAY! :)A quick note to those who don’t know…this book really is a delight, everyones either enthralled by it or runs a mile, u will enjoy, faint and exam your own minds eyes as you read through is magical press… Fact :)But you know I also have a load of other analytical skills that I have acquired over the years, from walking thousands of miles through a vision of flowing information and theoretical endeavors in the dead of winter and in the heat of the midday sun-shadows.So with that In mind and the Internet doing live streaming what better time than to test out a theory of coincidence.How it works is that at any given time or with a photo I will give my opinion on the given visual stimuli, so as the narration comes alive it will supply a direction or flow of energy, this can be used by the viewer to translate and question certain elements of their own lives that may bond with the the jackanory (story) for what is a language without spelling and spells!?Sanity disclaimer..I’m no magician, seer or whichdoctor! but asking questions for development of self in my opinion can’t be all bad.The actual connection of real life elements in real time has the power to prove quantum entanglement and could hold the possibility to connect to another dimension… Or maybe not, but let’s find out…The rewards come in the form of a real life ebook, quantum consultations, and a load of odds and ends that I’ve picked up in my travels.Apart from testing this quantum entanglement theory of coincidence, the money raised will fuel further art projects and a new book which of course you have first dibs on…

story:
The Project 

I have always held the  belief that art has the capacity to change the world. , Through my work as a muralist, art teacher, and community arts educator/activist, I have always been driven to unify the beauty and power of art with the potential for positive change.   In spring of 2014, after spending over a year collecting responses to the epidemic of police brutality by artists, journalists, historians and social theorists, I developed a concept for a multimedia community exhibition bringing together art and education to increase public awareness and participation in the movement for change.  

I brought the idea to the Social and Public Art Resource Center,  an L.A. institution that's brought the arts of social justice into the community for almost 40 years.  This exhibition is slated for spring of 2016, and will  mark 25 years since the videotaped Rodney King beating, illustrating the ongoing history of racism and excessive force in U.S. law enforcement.  

 It features a visual timeline from 1991-2016, highlighting significant and lesser known cases, legal developments, media reactions, and social network commentary alongside visual arts, music, spoken word poetry, games and interactive video.  Additionally, the exhibition will feature education workshops, storytelling events (for members of the public to record their own experiences), performances, and speakers’ panels, allowing everyone in the community to have their say. 

Where It Will Take Place

SPARC has funded, restored and protected hundreds of L.A. murals, and is largely responsible for maintaining the city's vibrant public art tradition;  the organization's Durón Gallery has also become an exciting public art space.  Exhibiting work on issues affecting underrepresented communities, SPARC shows are accompanied by public events that stimulate awareness, further dialogue, and encourage action .  While SPARC has an amazing space and great community access, they lack the funding to bring the multimedia elements of this exhibition to life, so I decided to launch a crowdfunding campaign to accomplish this dream.  

Where Your Donations Go

This is a subject I feel passionately about, and I am determined to bring the project to fruition.  I have donated all my time and expenses towards fulfilling this goal.  However, I cannot fund the entirety of the project on my own.  These are the minimum funds we need to make this project come to life: 

$1500- Shipping and insuring artwork.  While some artists volunteer to pay for covering costs of shipping their work, others cannot.  This will cover those artists' expenses, in order to make this a truly equitable exhibition with a diverse selection of work.

$3500- Media purchases and loans, plus installation. This show uses  traditional traditional visual media in combination with monitors, projections, audio, and interactive technologies to add up to a timely multimedia event.  Donations will be sought, but this will cover the minimum media equipment needed to pull it off.  

$2500: Speaker and performer fees, plus other event costs. Speakers’ panels and events will be open to the public, and we will seek volunteers, but this will cover those who need reimbursement for transportation or other costs; seating, security, and other event setup and clean-up.

$1500: Documentation and publication. Documenting the exhibition is a key element of the show, through photography and video archives, plus recordings of the audio and visual participation of the community.  Posters and a catalogue will be produced for sale to benefit organizations that fight for criminal justice reform.  

$1000: Educational workshops.  Although I will donate my time and will work with teachers at neighboring schools to create meaningful education workshops alongside the exhibition, we will need costs of materials and transportation to get groups from low-income schools to and from the exhibition, and to provide the necessary materials for these activities.  

What Impact Will This Have?

In January 2015, I was one of 200 artists represented in New York non-profit gallery Smack Mellon's Respond, an exhibition focusing on police brutality which received unprecedented attendance and press coverage.  In  May 2015, a Los Angeles pop-up exhibition entitled Manifest Justice showed hundreds works by artists focused on social justice, and it also saw record attendance and media attention.  Both revealed a huge amount of public interest in creative responses to the ongoing inequalities in our society. This exhibition seeks to extend that conversation directly into communities impacted by police brutality, by representing diverse voices and illustrating an ongoing history in order to stimulate continued work towards reform. 

Who I Am

My name is D.E. Stenvoll-Wells, and I’m an African-American artist, community arts activist, and art educator.  I grew up in Los Angeles and started my career as a muralist working with at-risk youth in East L.A.  My professional life became entwined with education when I started teaching art shortly afterwards, and I spent the following 10+ years teaching art in a variety of public and private institutions all over the world, including Washington, D.C., the South Bronx, New York, London, India, and the SF Bay Area.    

Why This Matters to Me

In summer of 2014, I was deeply affected by the images of Michael Brown’s body left in the hot sun for hours, which brought to mind my brother’s death in fall of 2013.  He died in his adopted country of Switzerland, following a long bout with mental illness.  Despite having knowledge of his identity, Swiss authorities failed to notify my family for more than two months after his death, and their careless approach to his tragic end made the ’Black Lives Matter’ movement hit close to home for me.  In honor of my brother, I launched the Art Responders social networking community in fall of 2014.  In early 2015, I partnered with several local organizations to raise money for education and advocacy with my Black Lives Matter calendar; I also exhibited my Art Responders portrait series around San Francisco, and Art Responders expanded into a vehicle for curating arts with a social justice emphasis.

Will It Be Worth It?  Those who know my work as an educator and public artist know the passion and commitment I’ve put into community and art education in the past.  I'm determined to put all my resources into making this an inclusive and insightful creative contribution to the current fight for civil rights justice.  As illustrated in the video, modern history is punctuated by pivotal moments where art played a significant role in social progress; as noted by the video's narrator Alice Williams, "this could be one of them."

I have the full support of SPARC staff, including co-curator Marietta Bernstorff, Creative Director Judy Baca (recent winner of the prestigious United States Artists prize), Executive Director Debra Padilla, and the hard-working SPARC staff to bring this project to fruition. We will enlist volunteers and local institutions to offer donations and gallery support.  Additional fundraising will be completed in early 2016 for promotion of the event, speakers' fees and other additional expenses.

If we are lucky enough to get further sponsorship, we will bring the show to other cities.  A partnership with Oakland's social justice community arts collective, RockPaperScissors, is already in the works.  

In my lifetime, I've seen huge strides accomplished by minority groups seeking liberation from existing societal boundaries.  In recent years, we've seen changes for womens' and LGBTQ rights that would have been unimaginable twenty years ago.  A big part of what's made this possible is a change in public perception and heightened awareness of their common humanity and the suffering that has been caused by their oppression  Much of this awareness has come from the arts.  By bringing together the many powerful works that artists have made on this topic, alongside public participation within an open and honest exchange of experiences and ideas, I hope to further discussion and constructive action to prevent any more needless abuses and deaths at the hands of police.  Let's fight this shameful American phenomenon by joining together, illuminating the truth, and envisioning  a world where no citizen lives in fear of racist and violent law enforcement!

story:
About Elsewhere

My name is Hong Hong, and I am an installation artist who lives and works in Hartford, CT. I was recently given an opportunity to curate, organize, and put together Elsewhere, an art exhibit for Artspace Hartford. Elsewhere features contemporary artists from Connecticut as well as across the nation. The works in this show explore the intersection between memory and imagination through painting, sculpture, fiber, and new media. This campaign will be fund the planning, publicity, and execution of this exhibit as well as its opening reception on February 13. 

Elsewhere was dreamed up by volunteers who are artists themselves, which means it has a very, very tiny budget. Every single donation, no matter how small, makes a world of difference to us. By choosing to support Elsewhere, your generosity sustains the careers of seven artists, who are each fully committed to their practice. Your donations also gives us an opportunity to be a part of Hartford's growing ecosystem of dreamers, thinkers, doers, and makers of all kinds of magic. Collectively, we can continue to strengthen and to vitalize Hartford's creative community.  Help us help art grow! Help us help Hartford grow!


About the Artists

Get to know the artists and their work by viewing the campaign video at the top of this page! 


Funding

The funds from this campaign will be used for the following expenses:
  • Design and print of all publicity materials for exhibit
  • Installation and deinstallation hardware
  • Opening reception set-up and supplies
  • Artist stipends to help offset shipping and transportation costs. Several artists who are a part of this exhibit will be sending artwork from other states. 
Consider this: if 80 people each chose to donate $10, this campaign will be a complete success.


Perks

There are a number of awesome perks for this campaign! Take a look at selected examples below, and please view this campaign's gallery for all available works. 

1. Digital Prints

All prints are photographs of original works by Manty Dey, Hong Hong, and Amy Vensel. They come in a variety of sizes and packages, depending on the level of your contribution.

2. Paintings

Two original paintings are available to contributors of $150. One is by Adam Viens, and the other is by Andres Chaparro. 

3. Sculpture

An original, cast-plaster ice cream sculpture, by Jourdan Joly, is available to a contributor of $200.

 

4. Commissioned Paper: 

An original, personally commissioned sheet of Kozo paper, by Hong Hong, is available to a contributor of $250. The dimensions of this personalized work of art measures 24 in x 36 in. The palette and theme are up to the contributor.


 
Other Ways You Can Help

If you can't contribute financially but would still like to help Elsewhere, please spread the word by sharing the link to this campaign. If you are based near the Hartford area and would like to assist during the installation and/or the opening reception, please email me at hhonghongh@gmail.com. 


& One Last (& Most Important) Thing

Without you, none of this is possible. Thank you so much.

story:
Short Summary

Declaration of Independence Covenant Experience

  • Help give our nation its ultimate birthday gift.  Restore what being American really means.  15 amazing paintings by top American artists.  Moving narrative script.   Presentation movie.  Art book and stories.   Life changing, nation saving experience for everyone.

  • My name is Farley Anderson.  I have brought together some our nation's top artists and created an amazing patriotic experience that I have been sharing around the country.  With your help we can reach millions and change the course of our country in the most positive way.  

America is falling apart. Please help reintroduce  the Declaration of Independence as the American covenant to our Nation.  I have personally presented this to many thousands but it needs to reach millions.  Our youth have been robbed of their birthright of freedom and liberty.  They do not know the true stories and miracles that brought us together as One Nation Under God!  We have engineered a most powerful experience, each painting (ck out the gallery) and narrative building upon the last until everyone understands that Americanism is a covenant between the people, the government and God.  
  • Our Goal is to make this experience available to every church, school and patriotic event especially targeting Boy Scout and youth camps and programs.  I have experienced 12 year old boys in tears as they feel what being American means.  Last fall I presented to one group of 1200 boy scouts and numerous other groups and gatherings.  The largest groups included over 2500.  This message is a best hope we have of saving our nation, just as the best hope of saving any failing marriage is to put God back into the relationship.  We have created the art and message and need help with the printing and distribution.  Our ultimate goals  require much more than we are seeking here, but this amount gets us started and we can be self-funding in many ways after this initial investment is reached. 
  • Imagine a nation united. The Declaration of Independence originally united us with the great self evident truth that all men are created equal.  We can recognize that the only true minority is the minority of one.  We respect the separate and equal station to which we all are entitled.  We can become a nation "born again".  We have to re-learn respect for life, liberty and the pursuit of happiness of all of our universally created brothers and sisters. This is the message of Declaration of Independence and something I truly believe in.  I have invested my personal all to take this message to our nation, please help with the little needed to expand so anyone can teach or experience this life changing nation saving presentation.  

  • Covenant of the Declaration of Independence PDF Poster


What We Need & What You Get

  • We are need of $16,500.00 for a print run of all of the individual art pieces and for the duplication of the DVD movie and assembly of the art books.  This allows a launch to share the project and make it so many others can do what I have been successfully doing. Many people tell me  this was the most important presentation ever attended. The creative work is complete, the artwork is painted and the narrative is written.  We are so very close to being able to share this with our nation. Please help.
  • Make this the best July 4th ever by doing somthing meaningful for our nation.   Be among the first in the nation to share this experience with those you love.   We are offering this experience for very little cost as our mission is to teach and inspire and you are a big part of this process.  Look over and choose one or more of the perk packages.  The change in America begins with you.  
  • If we do not reach our entire goal we will still deliver the perks as promised but will be limited in the speed we can deliver. I will keep at this until we raise the necessary money for as long as it takes.   

Risks & Challenges

We have come so very far using personal resources and loans, investors, and especially the willingness of the artists to contribute their talent with the hope of receiving enumeration at some future unspecified time as their painting sell.   I will personally see that the perks are delivered, but it is possible that the delivery date may be extended.  We have not yet set up the legal work for the non-profit but that will be coming as we secure the funds.  

Other Ways You Can Help

  • Remember to use the Indiegogo share tools! Consider a committee to make a perk purchase for your church or school or event. Download and share the free handout/poster.  spread the word.

  Risks & Challenges
We have come so very far using personal resources and loans, investors, and especially the willingness of the artists to contribute their talent with the hope of receiving enumeration at some future unspecified time as their painting sell.   I will personally see that the perks are delivered, but it is possible that the delivery date may be extended.  We have not yet set up the legal work for the non-profit but that will be coming as we secure the funds.     Other Ways You Can Help
 Remember to use the Indiegogo share tools! Consider a committee to make a perk purchase for your church or school or event. Download and share the free handout/poster.  spread the word.

story:
What is this project?

Hi, I'm Katrina! My mission as an artist is to promote kindness and activate compassion in order to help create a brighter and more mindful world. My project is The Solution to Everything. I chose this title because I believe that many of the world's problems could be solved if we were all more kind and compassionate as a society. TSTE is a multidisciplinary installation made up of:

  • abstract paintings that convey the essence of loving-kindness
  • paper sculptures and assemblages made from my own weathergrams (I'll explain what these are a bit later.)
  • LED lights
  • an interactive element (I'll explain this more later, too.)
  • confetti

Yes, I said confetti! Not only is TSTE intended to make a positive impact, but it also invites people to participate in spreading kindness both by contributing to the installation and also through acts of kindness. Thus, the project is a collaboration between artist and the public. 

I am honoured to be invited to exhibit this installation at the Florence Biennale in October of 2021 (It is possible that the biennale will be postponed to 2022 due to the pandemic). This is the biggest opportunity of my career to achieve my mission for good at such a high level. 

TSTE is a reincarnation of my previous project Weathergrams for Good. This public artwork was commissioned by the City of Fredericton (New Brunswick, Canada) and installed in front of city hall. The installation was made up of two large-scale structures featuring thousands of weathergrams strung up on chains and wooden posts. The structures surrounded a garden area and some trees, allowing the weathergrams to live in harmony with nature. Loving-kindness mantras were printed on each of the thousands of weathergrams and intended to radiate kindness into the community. Visitors were invited to engage by writing their own messages of kindness on blank weathergrams, which were then added to the installation. Global News broadcast a segment on national tv about this project. You can view the short clip here.

 

What are weathergrams?

Most people don't know what weathergrams are. They were developed in the 1970's by art professor Lloyd J. Reynolds, who was inspired by a Japanese cultural tradition. Weathergrams are strips of paper that are hung outside to become weathered by the elements. They contain a poem or inspiring phrase that is meant to delight whoever comes across them.

As a kid, I was introduced to weathergrams by a dear family friend named Swede. He was a practitioner of the traditional weathergrams, where italic poems were written on brown paper strips. I honour these traditions, and respectfully add my own twist. My weathergrams are colourful strips of paper, many of them hand-painted. Rather than poems, I print a loving-kindness mantra on the paper that I have carefully curated from the metta mindfulness tradition.

 

Why this needs to exist

It is alarmingly clear that the world is struggling with division in the midst of this devastating pandemic. Speaking personally, it has been difficult to remain hopeful during these dark times. We each need to step up and do what we can to contribute to efforts of unity and compassion. As an artist, I am fully committed to this, which is why I am creating this project. 

This is not *just* an artwork. It is the catalyst for a tidal wave of compassion. Visitors to this installation will be enveloped in the energy of loving-kindness from viewing and interacting with all of the colourful and uplifting art. They will be invited to participate by writing their own messages of kindness on weathergrams. Not only that, but I will be giving out discrete cards that challenge the person to perform an act of kindness for a stranger. They will be encouraged to give out the card to the recipient of their kindness, and the pay-it-forward momentum will ripple outwards. 

 

Getting others involved

In addition to the kindness challenge cards, the mission of this project will be directly impacting many others in several ways. First, through a series of workshops for adults. The first workshop will take place at the Florence Biennale as part of the educational aspect of the event. What's even more exciting and potentially impactful is my plan to bring Weathergrams for Good to schools. The school initiative will empower entire school communities to promote kindness and activate compassion through the act of creation. 

This project has no end it sight! It has SO MUCH potential to do good and uplift people through both the exhibition aspect and the educational aspect. Without concerted effort, our society will continue to struggle with toxic divisiveness. Please join me in contributing to the solution... the solution to EVERYTHING: spreading kindness.

 

How to Get Involved

Creating this artwork and presenting it in Italy is no small feat, nor a cheap one. The expenses make it impossible for me do the project on my own. After adding up the many costs, I estimate it will cost over $20k, and that's BEFORE I pay myself anything. Expenses include registration fees, materials, professional packing costs, overseas shipping through the approved company (DB Schenker), customs import fees (in Italy), professional photography and videography for documentation, flights, accommodations, and more.  It sounds like a lot, but with the support of many of you, it can happen!

I need the support of like-minded patrons who also want to see a positive change in the world. I invite you to support this project in one or more of the following ways:

  • Share this campaign with your people and talk about it to those who you think share the same values. Help spread the word and generate potential supporters!
  • If you can, sign up for one of the paid perks to the right of this screen. There are lots of options to choose from! Think of it as being a Patron of Compassion, with some cool artsy bonuses.
  • Consider if your workplace or company may want to become an official sponsor. There are so many great perks (outside of Indiegogo) that are offered by the organizers of the Florence Biennale. See the list below:
    • Logo and link published on the official website
    • 4 invitations to inauguration ceremony (for 2 persons each)
    • Logo published on the official Catalogue
    • 4 VIP entry badges
    • 4 complimentary copies of the official catalogue
    • Logo on the “Sponsors of the Artists” panel
    • 12 complimentary tickets to the exhibition
    • Logo on the Artist name label
    • Speaking opportunities

 

The Perks

So many great options! There are more details for each perk on the section to the right of the screen.

  • Donation of $20 = three handmade weathergrams mailed to you. These babies radiate positivity and cheer wherever they are hung!
  • Donation of $50 - ten handmade weathergrams mailed to you. Ten is a great amount to really create an eye-catching display. Or you might want to keep some and give some away as gifts!
  • Donation of $100 - 12x16" limited edition embellished art print & special gift.
  • Donation of $200 - 20x26" limited edition embellished art print & special gift.
  • Donation of $500 - Original painting made as a study for this project. Painting is acrylic on yupo paper. There are 4 options to choose from, only 1 of each because they are original paintings. Each painting is inspired by a loving-kindness mantra and created to radiate uplifting energy into the world. Plus, a special gift!
  • Donation of $1000 - A beautiful strand of dozens of handmade weathergrams. This strand is created as a study for the exhibition and is 6 feet in length. It can be displayed inside either vertically like a hanging sculpture, or strung up like a festive garland. PLUS a special gift.
  • Donation of $2,000 - A full strand of handmade weathergrams from the exhibition! This is an original one-of-a-kind work of art that features handmade weathergrams strung up on a strand of LED lights. Lengths vary between 10-12 feet. PLUS a special gift.
  • Donation of $5000 - A larger strand of handmade weathergrams from the exhibition! This is an original one-of-a-kind work of art that features handmade weathergrams strung up on a strand of LED lights. Lengths vary between 20-25 feet. PLUS official sponsor status and all the perks offered from the Florence Biennale organization (see list above). PLUS a special gift.

If you are interested in contributing as a donor but are not interested in these perks,  or if you wish to contribute an amount not listed above, please reach out to me at hello@katrinaslade.com.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Some of you might really love this project but are not able to contribute financially at this time. But there are other ways you can help out!

  • Get the word out and make some noise about this project! Share with family, friends, followers, and more. Just the simple act of sharing information with others will help to potentially bring in more donors, and most importantly... help raise awareness of the mission of the project.
  • Indiegogo has share tools! You can easily share from this website to your social media platforms!
  • Can you think of a potential company or brand that might be a great partner for this project? Reach out to me! Email me at hello@katrinaslade.com

Thank you from the bottom of my heart for giving me your most precious resource: time. If you have read all the way to the end, you are awesome and I appreciate you so much.

story:
Hey everybody! So for those of you who know me and how I shed blood sweat and tears to write this book and am ready to launch this coming June!

I do have one small problem though and that is launching my website which I can’t afford now because I lost my job Due to the pandemic. 

To those who are able to donate a larger sum 50$ and above I will be shipping them a hard copy And 30$ and above a paperback copy.

If you feel you have the ability to help, then so be it even if it’s a $1, because every dollar counts and if not that is fine, and again if you can’t donate, please just share this, regardless much love. 
thank you all Sincerely, The King of love ??

 

The Handsome Twist is a dark fiction fairytale inspired by the very true events in the author’s life, being raised in Iran as a LGBTQ+ male, which for many who don’t know is equivalent to a punitive fatality in this country. Due to tackling topics such as perverse behavior, taboo lust, political oppression, prostitution, maltreatment, rape and homicide, written in high volume of vulgar language, this book is aimed to target the more mature audience of the LGBTQ +The hopes of the author is for many to relate to the struggles of victim hood. Living with the consistent crisis of “identity trauma” that many of the LGBTQ+ members like himself have suffered and share as a mutual, daily battle. I 

The ultimate message of this book is to inspire ALL THE COLORS OF THE RAINBOW to gash through the clouds of darkness surrounding their lives and allow themselves to shine like the lights they are with the healing power of Love!
