story:
Problem

Artists play a vital role in reshaping society through their creative work. The world is full of artists who belong to different areas of art including painting, architecture, sculpture, literature, music, dance and cinema. Due to their work, these artists help people to explore the beauty of nature. In effect, it increases their importance in society. It means that artists have strategic importance in society. Struggling artists and entrepreneurs face different problems, which include challenging environment, smaller network, financial issues, and fewer opportunities. Other problems of struggling artists and entrepreneurs include lower support, unable to afford supplies and limited reach to audience. These problems create different challenges for artists to succeed and achieve their career goals.

Research shows that different problems of struggling artists and entrepreneurs around the globe include negative attitude, lack of sales, incomplete knowledge to take advantage, wrong target audience and failure to market oneself online. Overall analysis shows that there is dire need to provide network and support to struggling artists and entrepreneurs. They need a platform, which can help them to analyze market, develop innovative art designs and crafts, sell these art designs and craft, and achieve desired career goals. Considering the need of struggling artists and entrepreneurs Brooklyn Ubuciko Festival has launched its platform.

Brooklyn Ubuciko Festival

Brooklyn Ubuciko Festival is the biggest global virtual arts festival, which will be held on August 16th,  2020. The Festival aims to help struggling artists and entrepreneurs around the globe that do not have a platform to work. Brooklyn Ubuciko Festival is organized and managed by Brooklyn Ubuciko Festival, LLC. Our main purpose of this event is to help artists and entrepreneurs to deal with different problems of their challenging environment, smaller networks, financial issues, and fewer opportunities. On other side, audience will be able to buy different art designs and crafted material, and enjoy different activities of event for a week.

This event caters two groups of individuals: artists and entrepreneurs around the globe.

Artists and Entrepreneurs

Artists and entrepreneurs of will be able to display their talent through creative art design and craft. Creative art and design will focus upon painting, sculpture, literature, and music. Artists and entrepreneurs will display their art design and craft, which will directly help them to promote their designs and services, connect with community and develop their network. Brooklyn Ubuciko Festival will provide following key benefits to artists and entrepreneurs during virtual festival,

  • A great platform to artists and entrepreneurs.
  • Festival will help artists and entrepreneurs to achieve desired career goals.
  • They will have opportunity to build and develop network.
  • It will help artists and entrepreneurs to sell their innovative art and craft designs
  • The Festival will help artists and entrepreneurs to build strong community

Audience Focused Brooklyn Ubuciko Festival

Brooklyn Ubuciko Festival is virtual festival, which will provide wonderful experience to audience. To make it highly engaging event, interactive activities will be performed for a week.

A Full Week of Interactive Activities

  • Cooking Experience with Two Top-Notch Chefs: Audience will get a shopping list to cook along with two top-notch chefs. This virtual experience will add value to the lives of audience. As audience will learn to cook new food items, which will be unique experience, therefore this will be great experience.
  • Yoga and Spirituality: Online yoga and spirituality classes will be part of festival. Through online yoga and spirituality class, audience will focus upon mental and physical health, which will bring great results to them in future. Moreover, learning to meditate and staying fit during tough times will bring positive change to the lives of audience.
  • Online Detailed Discussion and Interactive Section: Curated discussions with hosts about sex, current political issues, startups, art, and design will be the part of festival.
  • DJs and Dance Music: For each day, there will be two hours shift of music to keep people engaged and energized.
  • Photography Classes:  Photography classes can be great learning opportunity for audience to learn new and polish their existing photography skills. These classes will help individuals to learn how to shoot photos that tell a story, choose the right gear, create a photo book, and make videos.
  • Interactive Sip & Painting classes for adults and children
  • Financial Literacy: Financial experts will discuss about managing personal and business finances. This knowledge will help people to manage personal finances effectively
  • Open Mic Night
  • Health Task Force: Health Task Force is the team of psychologist, health professionals, nutrition experts and fitness trainers. Group of these individuals will provide guidelines and trainings to individuals through live sessions.
  • Learning how to Vogue: Choreographers will provide online live classes about how to vogue which will help people to start their career in vogue. Value added suggestions to people about vogue, and their career will be provided.
  • Live Auctions from Notable Artists: Live Auctions of notable artists will be held. People will be able to purchase art design and crafts through live auctions. Each artist will chose one work of art to auction off.
  • Live performances from bands and singers
  • Mental Health Talks: Mental Health Talks will focus upon different areas of mental health including but not limited to emotional, psychological, and social well-being of human being. Discussion will also cover how we think, feel, act and manage stress.

Music Concert

Music Concert is the special part of Festival, which will add wonderful experience to audience. We have invited musicians, singers, and bands belonging to following category of music,

  • Rap Music
  • Pop Music
  • Jazz Music
  • Hip Hop Music
  • Soul Music

Live performance is the main component of virtual festival where audience will explore types of music and enjoy. In addition to that, famous DJs are invited who will enlighten people’s experience.

How Funds will be Used?

Running Virtual Brooklyn Ubuciko Festival requires total funding of $100,000. These funds will be used to design and launch Brooklyn Ubuciko Festival successfully. Funds will be used to support expenses related to following areas,

  • Arrange desired resources for Brooklyn Ubuciko Festival.
  • Design and develop promotional material for event.
  • Hire Project Team for event.
  • Afford all food, travelling and accommodation expenses of project management team and guests for defined time of one week.
  • Decoration related expenses.
  • Payments to trainers, consultants, healthcare professionals, chefs, and project management team for services.
  • Event hall rent and utilities.
  • IT professional services outsourcing fees
  • Insurance fees

Funds will be used to support above expenses.

Make sure to subscribe to our website http://bkubuciko.com

Make sure to follow us on Instagram as we will be making constant announcements @brooklynubuciko 

Thank You. One Love.

Hip Hop Music
Soul Music

Live performance is the main component of virtual festival where audience will explore types of music and enjoy. In addition to that, famous DJs are invited who will enlighten people’s experience.
How Funds will be Used?
Running Virtual Brooklyn Ubuciko Festival requires total funding of $100,000. These funds will be used to design and launch Brooklyn Ubuciko Festival successfully. Funds will be used to support expenses related to following areas,

Arrange desired resources for Brooklyn Ubuciko Festival.
Design and develop promotional material for event.
Hire Project Team for event.
Afford all food, travelling and accommodation expenses of project management team and guests for defined time of one week.
Decoration related expenses.
Payments to trainers, consultants, healthcare professionals, chefs, and project management team for services.
Event hall rent and utilities.
IT professional services outsourcing fees
Insurance fees

Funds will be used to support above expenses.

Make sure to subscribe to our website http://bkubuciko.com
Make sure to follow us on Instagram as we will be making constant announcements @brooklynubuciko 
Thank You. One Love.

story:
THE PROJECT! (A GIANT INFLATABLE WHALE THEATRE!!!)

Hey it's your friendly neighborhood puppeteer Ali! I'm a puppeteer and mayhem maker coming at you from NYC with a BOLD FRESH FUN NEW project! The past year I've been working in miniature (maybe you caught In the Time of the Blue Ball at Dixon Place) but we're are kicking it up a knotch--we're going GIANT. 

In 1893 on the North West Coast of France a whale washed up on the shore of a local beach. The people did what naturally one should do in that situation--create a theatre in the stomach of the whale. The theatre only lasted 3 days but its memory lives on and shall live on THIS MAY AT THE WASSAIC PROJECT. 

THAT'S RIGHT! I will be building a late 19th century theatre inside of the stomach of a giant inflatable whale this May as an artist in residence at the Wassaic Project in Wassaic New York and NEED YOUR HELP!!! 

In the past 2 years, I have worked extensively with inflatables in public performance in collaboration with Melbourne-based Snuff Puppets, Kinshasa-based Espace Masolo and students at the University of Stuttgart like these!:

(For more info on the projects visit: https://snuffpuppets.com/punchgermany/ and https://alexandragoss.com/the-short-life-of-punch)

What I have found spectators most excited to enter an inflatable as opposed to existing outside as a spectator.

Baleine de Villerville (in Wassaic!) will give life to a quixotic moment and let audiences dive straight into the art they view featuring inflatables, projection and puppetry performance. The whale isn't meant to be just viewed, it will serve as a stage for the Wassaic community and beyond to let their whale song be heard. 

THE MATERIALS!

The funds I am asking for will go towards materials. For this project I need: 

-yards and yards and yards of ripstop fabric (the standard for building inflatables) to build the body of the whale

-house paint to paint said whale

-lumber for building the theatre

-a floor dryer (one of these things! https://www.amazon.com/CFM-Pro-Carpet-Blower-Outlets/dp/B00K2BGER0) to inflate the theater! 

The rest of the funds will go towards defraying residency fees. 

THE PERKS!

In return for your support you could get zines! a custom puppet! a sleepover! And the knowledge that you've help made this whale a reality. 

BUT FOR REAL

This project is near and dear to me. Wassaic will be my first residency in my career as an artist and I'm excited for the chance to take a month to make this project a reality not only for myself but for those who will be able to make the whale a home for their own work. Wassaic as a residency has a deep commitment to their community ties and I'm excited to collaborate with the Wassaic community young and old in building a hub for ideas and performance in a unconventional setting. I only hope it stays standing longer than the three days the original whale did!

story:
What is Symbolikon

  • Symbolikon is an extensive library of Ethno-Esoteric-Mystic-Magical symbols for creatives, graphic designers, tattoo artists, and visual designers.
  • It contains 650+ ethnographic symbols, organized in 25 categories, with general meanings and specific description of each symbol. 
  • Every symbol is carefully redesigned in a consistent and modern style, available in 4 style variations (light, bold, outlined, colorable).
  • Symbols are provided in Vector (SVG, EPS) and Raster format (JPG, PNG) 

 

 

 

Symbolikon Digital Encyclopedia is a collection of symbols taken from historical, global civilizations, given a new life where ancient culture meets modern design.  Symbolikon is a journey of discovery, taking users through the symbols and iconography of historical cultures and ages, providing in-depth and meticulously researched information about meaning and origin.

We live in a world of symbols: from the stop sign at the end of your street, to the apps on your phone, the buttons you press to call the elevator up, or down, or shapes and shadows in the logo of your favourite brand. Symbols are everywhere. 

Symbols have history, too. They didn’t spring up out of thin air. Symbols pre-date our own, contemporary cultures and even our modern-day alphabets. Symbols represent objects, ideas and relationships, and they have done for thousands of years.

 

 

 

With Symbolikon, I have created a digital resource for all kinds of creatives to search, discover and integrate a vast number of symbols and styles into their work. I have organized this extensive library into 25 easy-to-use categories, tagged symbols using key-words and descriptions in order to ensure effective and efficient searching.

 

 

Why

As a creative designer, I have always been interested in symbols and their meanings. However, I struggled to find a set of symbols that were easy to use and well organized. In using symbols, I believe that it’s important to understand the meanings, origins culture, time frame, and symbolic frameset. 

I started to study symbols, in part because I was interested, but also because I knew that the knowledge would improve my professional abilities. What began as a small project has now evolved into an enormous database of more than 650 symbols, along with details of their origins and meanings. 

This is a resource that, as a designer, I find hugely valuable. Now, I would love to share this research with others who might also benefit from my work.

 

What categories are available?

 

What styles are available?

Every single symbol has 4 different versions, carefully designed for its own distinct purpose: 

  •  Light - for fine graphics 
  •  Bold - for a strong style 
  •  Outline - for a more complex visual 
  •  Colorable -  for color customization

 

 

Why the colorable version?

The colorable symbol style has been designed to be customized with user-selected color. Each individual element can be selected and modified, with either gradient or flat colors.  

Search the symbol you need using tags.

A useful combination of tags related to each symbol make the research easy and efficient. Tags help to get drive the search into the direction you need.

 

The Digital Encyclopedia of Symbols

Currently the only resources available for a good research about symbology are paper books, as digital designer I think that would be great to have a web resource easy to access from wherever, where to find a vector graphic symbol, read its description and look for further references.

Living in a "World of screens" we are overwhelmed of images, ancient symbols are bricks where our modern visual design bases itself. As much as we know about archetypal symbolism, as much as we can make meaningful designs and create new symbology.

Symbolikon Digital Encyclopedia is a collection of symbols taken from historical, global civilizations, given a new life where ancient culture meets modern design. 

 

 

What can I do with these symbols?

Here are just a few suggestions for the kind of projects users may embark upon using the Symbolikon library.

 

Illustrations for Game design

Jewelery design

Patterns for 3D design

Create graphic design for t-shirts.

Find inspiration for music artwork.

Create minimal Tarot cards using the Tarot category.​

Design unique works of art.

 

 

Why I need your help?

Ultimately, I believe that this is an important undertaking. As the speed of culture increases, we run the risk of losing sight of these elements of our past.

Living in a digital world, constantly confronted with screens and monitors. We are overwhelmed by images. Ancient symbols are the bricks upon which our modern visual design is built. The more we know about archetypal symbolism, the more we can make meaningful designs and create new symbols.

This has been a long journey, in which I have studied symbols, their origins, meanings, uses and their relationships with other symbols and events. It takes a lot of effort to discover and redesign each and every symbol.

I need your help to build a website to collect and organize new categories, symbols, style variation downloads and much more. I also need your support to extend the library and continue my research, growing the database and providing further resources for creative users.

 

How will the funds be used?

 

 

Additional Gifts for all backers unlocked!

 

Special edition inspired by the Lovecraftian Mythos: 
16 symbols inspired by the “Great Old Ones” original deities created by Lovecraft.

 

Symbolikon Wallpapers desktop and mobile.

 

Risks and challenges

This is not the first time I have thrown myself into a new venture and I’m fully aware of the risks and challenges involved. But then, that's what I’m about: Challenges and rising to them!

As the Symbolikon library is almost entirely complete in advance of the product launch, the primary challenge at this stage will be to secure the appropriate levels of funding to build the online resource.

A further challenge will be to reach out to the creative designers who will be our end users, in order to make them aware of the potential benefits of the Symbolikon library.

One final challenge will be to continually update and improve upon the product after it is launched. My goal is to create an extensive modern visual library of ancient and mystic symbols, and to build a community that enjoys being involved in a wide ranging cultural project where history, symbols and culture combine with graphic design. 
I believe that these challenges can and will be met. All I need now is your support.

story:
What We Do

In 2020, division was witnessed in various scenes.
Our challenge is to create a common symbol of confronting division to take the first large leap towards overcoming these distances.

Earth Light Project is a project initiated by youth volunteers in Japan, whose hopes are to preserve, and develop further connectivity amongst one another, despite the separation we feel which is caused by physical distances we are experiencing today.

Since the beginning of human history, people have gathered around flames to connect and share their lives with one another. The Olympic Torch, is another example of flame connecting people beyond borders and distances.

Given hints from the past, Earth Light Project will launch and take a photograph of “The Earth Light,” an ephemeral flame launched to stratospheric space, an atmosphere where one can view the world as a borderless planet. 

In Summer 2020, this project was supported by 655 people in Japan to prepare for the technological aspect of this project. The project has been endorsed by various supporters including individual “Dream Supporters” such as astronaut Ms. Naoko Yamazaki, Founder of Enhance, Resonair and Synesthesia Lab Mr. Tetsuya Mizuguchi, as well as companies and NPOs such as Panasonic, along with many others.

The project now needs YOUR generous support, this time to make the project a movement created by borderless effort.
 

Who We Are

Earth Light Project is a fully student-oriented project aimed to resolve division amongst the world by the hands of youth. The Founder, Norihiko Tsuzuki is a Ph.D student at Chiba University. Norihiko, the Chair of Student Organization Origami, has continued to expand the role of students and youth in the Olympic Paralympic Games.

In 2020, as the Tokyo Olympic Paralympic games has been postponed and division has accelerated, 30 student-run organizations with a total membership of 10,000+ students have joined to support the project. 

 

What We Need and What You Get

By purchasing the 2000 JPY  “Candle and Ticket Set”,  you will receive the following:
 

Candles

2020, took a lot away. One of them is, perhaps, the emotional conversations with those you now can only see online.
A candle brings people together by enabling people to share warmth, and emotion.  Through using a candle with specific intentions to create a shared atmosphere online, donators will be experiencing a shared moment with individuals in whom they are not able to have offline, emotional communications with.
 

Event Tickets

Users are strongly recommended to participate in Earth Light Project Events with their candles and tickets.
In these events held in April and May, purchasers of the candles will gather with the item. The event will enable us to share a globally connected moment regardless of location, ethnicity, or any other differences, and  will lead you into a realization of others who have the same hope and will to keep challenging to worship connectivity.
 

Honorable Mentions and Membership in the ELP Community

By participation, you will be part of the ELP community, a community gathering 100+ youth with various backgrounds, sharing their hopes towards a more connected world.The bonds and connection will hopefully move you forward with courage and excitement.
 

The Impact

We would also like to ask for your support in sending your candles (either resend the Earth Light Project Candles after use, or send us your Paraffin Wax Candles) to Earth Light Project after use to become part of a global legacy project.
 

Your support will be an imperative piece to the worldwide movement from the following points:

  • You will be able to participate in the Candle Events and the Launch Event alongside with other supporters around the world
  • The participants would highlight the effort and energy of youth to stay connected, or further expand their connection despite the current situation
  • If sent back to ELP after use, your candle will be melted and combined with other candles from around the world, to make one global candle in which will be launched to the stratosphere to take a photograph of  a symbolic fire
  • The project would be the first ever time to collect candles from around the world, and send it to the stratosphere by the hands of individual planning and participance
 

Online Events

Please bring and light up your candle to join the online event held on
April 4th 18:00~20:00 (JST) and May 2nd to 4th.

On April 4th, we will see and surround the candle lights and hope for a brighter future at the same moment from every single corner of the world. (Days may be added)

After the candle event, individuals will be able to send their used candles to Earth Light Project. We will then mix these candles into one, and launch the candle to the Earth's stratosphere.
The launch will be live streamed as an event.
At the peak of the event, we will photograph the "Earth Light" flame lit outer space, with the blue, borderless Earth in the background.

The artwork created by the participants of the campaign will be passed down to the future by the following projects run by ELP.

 

Other Ways You Can Help

Please check our website below to see other ways you can help and become a part of this global movement!

https://earth-light-project.org/

story:
Je suis Jérémy, né en septembre 1982 à Amiens. J’ai grandi parmi les chevaux en Normandie, pratiquant à un niveau national le CSO (Concours de Saut d’Obstacles) puis l’attelage.

Je possède mon « galop 7 », validant un haut niveau technique, théorique et pratique en équitation.

Je pratique maintenant, depuis quelques années, l’endurance équestre au niveau international, discipline encore peu connue, et pourtant 2ème discipline équestre française par le nombre de licenciés. (la FFE, Fédération Française d’Equitation, est la 3ème fédération sportive française, derrière le football et le tennis)

L’endurance équestre, c’est :

-  Parcourir de longues distances à cheval (jusqu’à 160km !), sur terrain varié, le plus rapidement possible

-  Préparer progressivement son cheval : on doit se qualifier sur une distance avant de pouvoir passer à une distance supérieure

-  Respecter son cheval : tous les 30km environ, des vétérinaires examinent le cheval pour déceler d’éventuels signes de fatigue ou de blessure. S’ils soupçonnent le moindre problème à venir, le couple est éliminé

-  La rigueur : arriver à un niveau national, voire international, implique une rigueur à tous les niveaux (alimentation, ferrure, soins vétérinaires, entraînements (de 10 à 15h par semaine), matériel…)

-  L’équipe : une équipe d’assistance suit la course, informe stratégiquement le cavalier, prend soin du cheval lors des arrêts, supporte le cavalier et ses moments de stress…

J’ai la particularité plutôt rare d’être à la fois cavalier et propriétaire à haut niveau.

Je possède 2 chevaux, pur-sang arabe (race de prédilection pour le haut niveau dans cette discipline).

Je vous sollicite afin de me soutenir dans l'accomplissement de mes objectifs pour la saison 2016.
2 objectifs, un par cheval :
- Championnats de France à Argentan mi juillet
- Championnats du monde des 7 ans fin septembre

J'ai besoin de soutien pour :
- Alimentation et compléments
- Ferrure
- Vétérinaire
- Equipement
- Engagements compétition
- Déplacements
- Hébergements

Visibilité et valeurs défendues

La visibilité peut se faire au moins dans 3 contextes :

-  Les très nombreux entraînements

Avec ces objectifs, et 2 chevaux, c’est minimum 6 sorties en entraînements par semaine, entre 50 et 100km par semaine.

Au moins 2 sorties se font en van (support de communication possible) dont un dans un centre équestre (visibilité par un public ciblé)

La visibilité est essentiellement locale, et très « efficace ». C’est simple, mais la beauté de ces chevaux de sport fait qu’ils sont très regardés, qu’on me pose beaucoup de questions, on me demande des conseils…

-  Lors des courses

Plein de matériel est utilisé (autant de supports possibles)

Une équipe d’assistance s’active (de 3 à 5 personnes)

Le van stationne

Lors des nationales et supérieures, un box est loué pour le cheval, encore un support possible.

-  Internet : Je suis aussi actif sur le forum internet endurance équestre, et peux par exemple mettre en signature de mes messages le nom de mes soutiens (ou logos)

Selon la hauteur du soutien, un communiqué de presse en fin de saison avec citation du/des sponsors est également possible.

Le nombre de supports visibles et disponibles est donc nombreux :

-  Van, 4x4

-  Manteaux et blousons, ou T-shirt selon les saisons

-  Couvertures des chevaux, utilisées systématiquement en course

-  Rideaux de box

-  Seaux, utilisés en grand nombre lors des assistances

-  …


Les valeurs que je défends

-  La performance : je prépare mes courses de hauts niveaux pour faire la meilleure performance possible

-  La longévité : je prépare mes chevaux et fais tout pour que notre carrière commune soit la plus longue possible

-  Le respect : mes chevaux sont des compagnons faisant partie de ma vie quotidienne. C’est pourquoi, en plus de l’endurance, je pratique l’éthologie avec eux.

Comment m’aider ?

Si vous partagez mes valeurs sportives, que vous souhaitez vous associer à l’image d’un sport où l’effort et la persévérance sont récompensées, et en même temps soutenir le travail quotidien que cela demande, vous pouvez m’aider en participant soit financièrement, soit en nature (matériel, alimentation…)

J’étudie toutes propositions, et serai ravi de vous parler plus longuement de ma discipline, ma passion, mes chevaux.
story_txt:
Je suis Jérémy, né en septembre 1982 à Amiens.
J’ai grandi parmi les chevaux en Normandie, pratiquant à un niveau national le
CSO (Concours de Saut d’Obstacles) puis l’attelage.
Je possède mon « galop 7 », validant un haut
niveau technique, théorique et pratique en équitation.
Je pratique maintenant, depuis quelques années, l’endurance équestre au niveau
international, discipline encore peu connue, et pourtant 2ème
discipline équestre française par le nombre de licenciés. (la FFE, Fédération
Française d’Equitation, est la 3ème fédération sportive française,
derrière le football et le tennis)
L’endurance équestre, c’est :
- 
Parcourir
de longues distances à cheval (jusqu’à 160km !), sur terrain varié, le plus
rapidement possible
- 
Préparer progressivement son cheval : on
doit se qualifier sur une distance avant de pouvoir passer à une distance
supérieure
- 
Respecter son cheval : tous les 30km
environ, des vétérinaires examinent le cheval pour déceler d’éventuels signes
de fatigue ou de blessure. S’ils soupçonnent le moindre problème à venir, le
couple est éliminé
- 
La rigueur : arriver à un niveau national,
voire international, implique une rigueur à tous les niveaux (alimentation,
ferrure, soins vétérinaires, entraînements (de 10 à 15h par semaine), matériel…)
- 
L’équipe : une équipe d’assistance suit la
course, informe stratégiquement le cavalier, prend soin du cheval lors des
arrêts, supporte le cavalier et ses moments de stress…
J’ai la particularité plutôt rare d’être à la fois cavalier
et propriétaire à haut niveau.

Je possède 2 chevaux, pur-sang arabe (race de
prédilection pour le haut niveau dans cette discipline).Je vous sollicite afin de me soutenir dans l'accomplissement de mes objectifs pour la saison 2016.2 objectifs, un par cheval :- Championnats de France à Argentan mi juillet- Championnats du monde des 7 ans fin septembre











J'ai besoin de soutien pour : - Alimentation et compléments- Ferrure- Vétérinaire- Equipement- Engagements compétition- Déplacements- Hébergements

semaine.

(support de communication possible) dont un dans un centre équestre (visibilité
par un public ciblé)

locale, et très « efficace ». C’est simple, mais la beauté de ces
chevaux de sport fait qu’ils sont très regardés, qu’on me pose beaucoup de
questions, on me demande des conseils…
- 
Lors des
courses
Plein de matériel est utilisé
(autant de supports possibles)
Une équipe d’assistance s’active
(de 3 à 5 personnes)
Le van stationne

supérieures, un box est loué pour le cheval, encore un support possible.
- 
Internet :
Je suis aussi actif sur le forum internet endurance équestre, et peux par
exemple mettre en signature de mes messages le nom de mes soutiens (ou logos)

de saison avec citation du/des sponsors est également possible.
Le nombre de supports visibles et disponibles est donc
nombreux :
- 
Van, 4x4
- 
Manteaux et blousons, ou T-shirt selon les
saisons
- 
Couvertures des chevaux, utilisées
systématiquement en course
- 
Rideaux de box
- 
Seaux, utilisés en grand nombre lors des
assistances
- 
…

Les valeurs que je défends

La performance : je prépare mes courses de
hauts niveaux pour faire la meilleure performance possible

La longévité : je prépare mes chevaux et
fais tout pour que notre carrière commune soit la plus longue possible
- 
Le respect : mes chevaux sont des
compagnons faisant partie de ma vie quotidienne. C’est pourquoi, en plus de
l’endurance, je pratique l’éthologie
avec eux.

Comment m’aider ?

récompensées, et en même temps soutenir le travail quotidien que cela demande,

story: Chronicle Magazine is hoping to meet fundraising needs. Our expansion depends on the generosities of the student government and other patrons of the fine arts if we are going to continue bringing free biannual art and literary magazines to the campus and surrounding area. We encourage students, faculty, and other contributors to support our magazine by sharing or donating to the campaign. And make sure to read our spring issue coming out in April!
story_txt: Chronicle Magazine is hoping to meet fundraising needs. Our expansion depends on the generosities of the student government and other patrons of the fine arts if we are going to continue bringing free biannual art and literary magazines to the campus and surrounding area. We encourage students, faculty, and other contributors to support our magazine by sharing or donating to the campaign. And make sure to read our spring issue coming out in April!

story:
Why I am here:

The reason I started this crowdfunding project is simple. I am a talented writer and author, and I am passionate about my writing, but in today's world, sometimes that's not enough. I have been funding my own art for as long as I have been in the arts, and my budgetary restraints have held the quality of my work back in the past. My goal is to raise enough money to cover the cost to have my audiobook read by a talented actor, and professionally produced. I have already found the talent and negotiated an aggressive deal with the production company, but I still can't do it all on my own. If I raise enough to cover the costs of production, I will use the remainder for marketing.

What We Need & What You Get

Where it goes:

  • As mentioned above all of the funding raised will be used to either produce or promote the audiobook. The total cost of production will be around $800.00, of which I have to pay $400.00 up front. I am prepared to make this deposit out of my savings and will hope to replace that if, and only if, the entire goal is met. I am setting the goal at $500.00 because I can justify paying $300.00 out of my savings if absolutely necessary, but the remainder is a must have from outside sources. Exceeding the $500.00 goal is preferable.
  • For your contribution, I will be providing free audiobooks in the form of Mp3 CDs, and Audible downloads, as well as providing signed copies of the novel in hardcover and paperback. Certain backers will get the opportunity to have an honorable mention in the dedications page of the second edition of the novel (simply because the first edition will be complete and published before the funding goal date) and will be given the opportunity to meet and chat with me.
  • If for any reason I am not able to meet the mandatory $500.00 goal, what will happen? Time will pile up and I may lose the agreement I have with the talent and production company. Due to the actor wanting to read this book in particular, and my financial station, I was able to leverage the quality of my work and get the production costs down to HALF of their normal rate. For transparency, the normal rate for this company and actor is $150.00 per finished hour of audio. The book should be about 10 hours, give or take. My negotiated rate of $80.00 per finished hour is contingent upon paying the $400.00 up front on March 2nd, and the remainder upon completion, which should take no more than 60 Days (till the end of this crowdfunding campaign). SO... if I don't meet my goal, the production company will hold the final product, with the option to increase the rates for services, preventing the audiobook from seeing the light of day until I can justify the additional funds. I can tell you I am resourceful and driven, so the money will come from somewhere, and the book will be available soon, but i'd ratehr not miss a car payemtn to get it done!

Other Ways You Can Help

If you aren't in a place to help out financially, please do share this link to your Facebook, twitter, blog, etc. There are share tools provided by IndieGoGo to make it easy and fast.

    Everything is greatly appreciated, thank you for your time.

story:
(english below)                   

              Projet: Marécages   Martine Cyr 

Très jeune, j’ai été initiée à la peinture au sein d'une grande famille artistique, aux Iles-de-la-Madeleine. Sensible à la nature, elle est ma source d’inspiration, spécialement les environnements aquatiques.
  

UN

millier de zones humides sont détruites chaque jour

 

sur la planète au profit du développement!!!

VOTRE DON VA ME SERVIR À :

· La création de 12 tableaux de 4x5 pieds.

· L'agrandissement des 50 meilleures photos de format 18 x 24 pouces.    

· La réalisation de mon premier documentaire (court métrage).

· L'édition sous forme de livre, de mon journal de bord illustré…

. L'organisation de ces futures expositions.

À QUOI SERT CE PROJET???

Faire connaitre les marécages pour mieux les protéger.

 Une exposition qui est appelée à voyager et à être porteuse de messages.     


                                       

                                             
Mon projet c'est de vous partager la richesse des marécages
par la PEINTURE, la PHOTO, la VIDÉO et mon JOURNAL de BORD.

Séduite par ces écosystèmes, il y a plus de 2 ans, j’ai su dès le premier instant que j'en ferais mon havre de création. Je ne pouvais rester insensible à son déclin!

Commence alors mon aventure en solitaire! Parcourir des kilomètres à la recherche des marécages, avec la ferme idée de me servir de la peinture, de mon art pour protéger ces magnifiques espaces! Un voyage au cœur de la faune sauvage, mon plus beau des voyages...

                                        

J'ai d’abord commencé par faire des croquis en marécage pour enfin en exprimer sur toiles l'étendue de mes explorations. Par la suite, j'ai fait l’acquisition d’une caméra pour saisir des instants magiques. Et enfin, pour vous partager les scènes d'animaux dont j'étais témoin, j'ai filmé.


 Une exposition qui est appelée à voyager et à être porteuse de messages.      

                                     

C'est d'ailleurs avec une grande joie que je vous fais part de ma nouvelle:

Le dévoilement du projet Marécages se fera sur la côte Nord à Longue-Rive au Québec, au Centre d’interprétation des marais salés de juin à septembre 2016.


Ma  première exposition en tant qu’artiste engagée pour la survie des marécages!

                    

En devenant mes complices, soyez conscient

que votre implication va au-delà du simple don.

VOUS PROTÉGEZ LA VIE DE CES JARDINS AQUATIQUES!

                                                                                  

Comment pourrais-je garder pour moi seule tant de beauté et de fragilité ?

         

Ma mission, par ces moyens d'expressions, est d'attirer votre regard sur ces berceaux où la vie commence.

Je consacre à ce projet mon temps, mes ressources et mon énergie créative. C’est grâce à ma détermination et ma foi que je réussis à mener cette quête. Ayant déjà acquis le matériel visuel en nature, je suis en mesure d'entreprendre maintenant la création des 12 peintures. Ces futures œuvres représenteront les marécages sur les 12 mois de l'année et seront les illustrations du livre. Je vous emmène fuguer au travers mon journal de bord où je vous fais vivre des aventures uniques.                                                                                     

                           

Redevenons les gardiens de la Terre… Notre source de vie… 

                             

Merci à tous! 

Partager! Partager sur vos réseaux sociaux...

Il est important de faire connaitre nos magnifiques marécages et sensibiliser votre entourage... Si vous ne pouvez contribuer, soyez heureux de participer à cette cause en devenant le pigeon voyageur de cette vidéo!  

Je vous invite à visiter la galerie de mon site web  www.martinecyr.com


* ENGLISH *

Very young i was initiated to art painting in anartistic family, where I grew up in the Iles-de-la-Madeleine. Sensitive toward nature, it has always been my source of inspiration, especially aquatic environments.

A thousand wetlands are destroyed every day on the planet for development !!!My project is to share with you the wealth of wetlands through painting, photography, video and my logbook.

Seduced by those ecosystems, I knew from my first explorations that it would be my haven for creation and that I could not remain insensitive to his decline!

Thus began my solo adventure travelling kilometers in search of wetlands. With the firm conviction that my painting will help to save and promote this eco-system.

Your donations will serve me;· 

. The creation of 12 paintings 4x5 feet.

· The 50 best photos 18 x 24 inch size enlargement.

· The realization of my first documentary (short film).

 . Edit my illustrated log book.

For this project I started sketching in swamp. Eventually I did purchase a camera to capture magical moments, and  to share scenes of animals life that I witnessed and filmed.

This is in order to raise awareness and attract a new vision at these cradles where life begins.

          

Those donation will help to organize these future exhibitions and carry my messages.

Moreover, it is with great joy that I am sharing my latest new:
The unveiling of the Wetlands project will be on the north coast in Longue-Rive Quebec, Interpretation centre salt marshes. It will be my first exhibition as an artist committed to the survival of the marshes!

It's been almost three years that I devote to this project all my time, all my resources and my creative energy. I live in voluntary simplicity, and thanks to my determination and my great faith  I managed to build  this project.Now with all the visual information in hand, I am ready to make paintings that will be exhibited that will serve as illustration for my book.

              How could I keep to myself so much beauty and fragility?

                      

Become my accomplices in this project, be aware that your involvement goes beyond the simple gift. You become a committed partner that protects those gardens to maintain harmony.

 We all have the mission to protect our mother earth...
Our source of life ...

There is another way to participate in this cause (is to be) become a messenger of Wetlands project! Share !!!! Share the widest possible these videos on your networks! THANK YOU SO MUCH...

I invite you to visite my gallery in my web side www.martinecyr.com

story:
Help us give a voice back to the communities and raise local awareness in small towns in Wyoming where Art is being halved, cut, or has never even been taught.

Helping us meet our goal will allow us to fund a few iPad minis and the Adobe CC license to be able to produce more videos like this one: http://youtu.be/xSfV2zG_CcU.

Additionally, we will be traveling around the state this sumer and finding local community members and kids to help us create a series of videos about the importance of art, which we plan to distribute on a YouTube channel, through social media, and as many local venues as possible.

Benefit levels include a shout out through social media, an original art work by a kid, being added to the credits in one of the videos, or even the chance to be the narrators for one of the videos.
story_txt: Help us give a voice back to the communities and raise local awareness in small towns in Wyoming where Art is being halved, cut, or has never even been taught. Helping us meet our goal will allow us to fund a few iPad minis and the Adobe CC license to be able to produce more videos like this one: http://youtu.be/xSfV2zG_CcU. Additionally, we will be traveling around the state this sumer and finding local community members and kids to help us create a series of videos about the importance of art, which we plan to distribute on a YouTube channel, through social media, and as many local venues as possible. Benefit levels include a shout out through social media, an original art work by a kid, being added to the credits in one of the videos, or even the chance to be the narrators for one of the videos.

story:
ABOUT US

The Sharonville Cultural Art Center is a 501 C(3) non-profit located in Sharonville, Ohio with mission to have offer comprehensive arts and cultural initiatives for the City of Sharonville and the surrounding region. This nearly 100 year old building was saved from the wrecking ball about 10 years ago. Over the last few years the center has struggled to keep it viable while serving the community through their arts programs. The hefty mortgage and expenses to maintain this historic building makes it challenging to turn this facility around to meet the demands of the arts community. 


In 2014, the center received a sizable donation of a high end projector from a large local company. This donation has opened the doors for the SCAC to reinvent itself and become the center for artists in the community to share their work in theater, music and fine arts. Now is the time to continue this momentum. The SCAC REBOOT PROJECT will allow the SCAC to reinvest in the center and create a theater that will be world class in audio, sound, and picture. In addition, the lighting upgrades will improve the quality of theatrical productions and remove the nearly 50 year old (and potentially dangerous lights) from the theater. Increased bookings of film and theater will help make the center viable and provide a better experience for all filmmakers, children's theater, and adult theater. Ultimately, donations to the SCAC REBOOT PROJECT will allow the facility to continue its mission: a place that foster the ARTS in Sharonville (and Tri-state area) for generations to come!
 
WHAT THE COMMUNITY IS SAYING
“You can practice, practice, and practice but it’s not the same as getting in front of people and performing what you do. It’s one thing to be in your gallery and create a beautiful painting, but it’s another thing to be able to show that off to people. That’s why this venue is important, it gives local artists a place to showcase what they can do.” - Kevin Hardman, Sharonville City Mayor 

 “I remember the SCAC growing up as a kid and really loving the place, it had childhood movies I grew up with. This place grew up being one of the catalyst of why I love cinema and film.”  -  Michael Peake, Local Filmmaker 
"Communities struggle without an appreciation and emphasis on the arts, but people, both children and adults, thrive when they are in an environment that has a rich and vibrant arts and cultural scene. This is where great organizations like the SCAC come in. They offer a cornucopia of arts programming and help give our regional filmmakers an affordable, quality option to show their film." - Kat Steele, Director of Cincinnati Film Festival and City Producer of the 48 Hour Film Project

HOW WILL THE REBOOT BRING THE ARTS BACK TO THE COMMUNITY?

There are currently over 35 active arts organizations in the Cincinnati region, and many of them do not have a facility to express or share their work. The $40,000 needed for the center will allow it to be more of an effective arts center for these groups.

Creative Need

We’ve had filmmakers request the facility to have a better audio system to showcase their slate of films. We’ve gotten theater groups inquire if we could have safer and secure lighting to create a better experience for their audiences. The SCAC REBOOT PROJECT will be able to achieve this. 


Community Need

In most cases, the arts community are the first budgets cut. It has been proven that the arts is an important fundamental factor in a child’s development process. The SCAC will provide a space for the youth to have artistic exposure, providing creative growth for all learners in all ages.


Economic Impact

With SCAC being in the heart of historic Sharonville it is our hope that we can help drive economic impact and growth. The upgrades will allow for more events and therefore bringing more people to Sharonville. The increased traffic will allow for more reasons to go to restaurants and businesses in the downtown area.  

WHAT YOU GET FOR CONTRIBUTING
1. You get the satisfaction of helping promote the Arts in a historic center! 
2. For a $25 donation you get the above mentioned satisfaction as well as recognition on our campaign website! 
3. For a $100 donation you get the above mentioned satisfaction, campaign recognition, as well as 10% off the rental of your choice! (Up to a $150 value!)
4. For a $500 donation you get the above mentioned satisfaction, campaign recognition, membership at the SCAC, 20% off a rental of choice,  and a FREE WEEKNIGHT MOVIE PARTY in the newly upgraded theater! 
5. For a $1,000 donation you get the above mentioned satisfaction, campaign recognition, membership a the SCAC, 20% off a rental of choice, and a FREE WEEKEND NIGHT RENTAL of your choice (calendar permitting)! 

HOW THE EXPENSES ARE BROKEN DOWN?

  • New Lighting Package: $15,000 
  • New Surround Sound: $15,000 
  • New Seating: $10,000

story:
About Me: My name is Sabrina Claman, 18, and I will be a high school graduate by the end of this project. Drawing has been my passion since I was practically able to walk as a toddler. You see, I have this great big dream of becoming an illustrator. To do this, I plan on majoring in art and Japanese at the University of Iowa so that after my initial years in college, I can study abroad in Japan at one of the many illustration schools.

Goal: My hopes for this project are to generate enough support and donations so that I can buy the tools I need to start my illustration project and to help support my art education so that I can continue learning in this field. As a job throughout college, I would like to be able to practice and further my artistic skills, but my ultimate goal in life as an artist is to write and illustrate comic books. 

By advertising myself and this project in my community and online, I want to make a website called UM (like the awkward filler phrase in conversation when someone doesn't know what to say). 

UM stands for Understand Me, a website illustrating social and personal situations that are difficult to explain in words but are also very relatable. I'd like to be able to successfully represent complex ideas through art that stand for common problems or joys of the average person's life (ex. depression, simple joys, bullying, isolation, impacts from the media, emotions, etc.). I feel like discussing topics typically difficult to talk about would make the subject almost easier to understand. I decided to name it "UM" (Understand Me) because I have first-hand experience being someone who has difficulty expressing themselves and having "... Um..." come out of my mouth when all I wanted was to be understood. I think a website like this could be a form of support for many people and I'd like to make it to increase my experience and abilities as an illustrator.

What happens to the money? This project would help me to be able to pay for a website to advertise and create UM, to buy materials I need to improve my art, and support my art education so that my ultimate goal of professional illustrator is met. Sometimes, people who don't have to come up with the tools to make something do not understand why artists spend so much on tools. The reason is because we want to provide quality in our art, so we aspire after the best tools to make the outcome we desire. I want to make this website of meaningful art for people, the funds from this project can help with that until I can support the project with my own abilities (and with the help of my strong supporters who have already expressed interest in this project) in the future. 

Tools like a drawing tablet, editing and art programs, a scanner, quality paper, and illustration pens and markers. Here are some rough estimates of costs so that you can see where my numbers are coming from. 

      COMPUTER: According to the University of the Arts Laptop Requirement for incoming students, the school selected computers that were best compatible for the programs that would be used by each major. The computer selected for an Illustration major for their work was the 13in Macbook Pro (512 GB). Depending on the specific computer purchased (refurbished or new) this computer averages around $1,300. I used their selected computer as an estimate because they teach students to become illustrators and understand the kind of computer it takes to be compatible with the art programs and the extreme usage and space required for the job.

      ART PROGRAMS: The Adobe Photoshop CC page offers use of all of the art apps for $49.99 per month, so a year worth of the apps through Adobe would be around $600. (It will only increase, so for example, for four years time, that number will be around $2,400.)

Sketchbook Pro, a less expensive program that is commonly used with Adobe programs, costs around $25 per year. There are other suggested programs used interchangeably depending on the effect the user would like, such as watercolor, texturization, etc, for similar prices.

       GRAPHIC TABLET: The tablet many artists agree to call the ideal for an illustrator is the Cintiq 13HD. Additionally, Tablet's for Artist's review writes of the pros and cons and other qualities that the Cintiq 13HD has and why it is worth the price. The original price was somewhere around $1,300, but it has lowered to an average of $800.

       SCANNER: You might not think of a scanner as an artistic tool, but it is a huge stepping stone from going traditional art to digital art. A quality scanner makes the difference in how a piece of art turns out. The link at the beginning of this paragraph will lead you to an article that explains the important qualities of a scanner for an illustrator. It suggests an Epson Perfection v600 or an Epson Workforce DS-50000  Colour Document Scanner for people who are planning on pursuing artistic ventures similar to mine. The prices of such scanners range around $200 for the former, cheaper option to around $1,000 for the higher end, latter option.

       TANGIBLE MATERIALS: This would include tools such as artist markers, pens, and paper. Pens and markers of quality for color and usability last me a couple months (2-4) per set depending on intensity of use and cost $15-$25 per set and another $12 for non-bleed paper.

       WEBSITE: To own and function a website, costs are about $50 per month, so around $600 per year. It also would be handbuilt and the price could differ depending on which website builder chosen to create the website in the end.

Total and Time: The reason why $10,000 is the goal fundraising amount isn't because the tools will cost $10,000 to start out. When the fundraising is over, Understand Me Illustrations will have a bank account of its own to store all funds for future monthly payments and investments. Investments like if UM Illustrations were to choose to create t-shirts or create a scholarship opportunity for students in the future, just as two examples. All of the money raised will be put towards the improvement, betterment, and growth of Understand Me Illustrations to help people who need the connection we want to offer.

I will ideally have the website created and be advertising UM Illustrations to boost support by the end of August 2016. On a personal note, I am currently working on three traditional jobs, but I am limited to only being able to do art for people in my hometown area due to lack of access to others and my materials. By making a project that reaches so many people digitally, I hope to be able to let my art impact others positively more. Understand Me Illustrations deserves to thrive and when I have the opportunity to put it in the digital world majority of us are familiar with, it has a better chance to.

-----

My favorite aspect about art is the ability to move people through images. In today's digital world, I would like the chance to be able to put myself out there and try to move others with my work. I really appreciate the support I have for this project. Thank you.

Feel free to add to the data pool to help me to understand you with this short survey.

Like us on Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/profile.php?id=1000089... Spread the word!

story:
Debut

My Name is Chuck Stableford, I am an emerging artist here in Honolulu Hawaii. This summer I was awarded an Orvis Residency by the Honolulu Museum of Art to produce an exceptionally large mixed media artwork titled Rift which measures 4' by 80'  still in progress but 90% completed.  The Residency will be ending on 16 August, and I need to remove and replace the wood frames used to mount to the current wall with modular steel frames, and store the work until it can find a permanent home. I need help funding fabrication of steel frames for the panels, storage and transportation and humbly ask for assistance from art enthusiasts and supporters.

  • Contributor's funding will provide modular steel installation frames and storage until arrangements for the artwork's new home can be concluded

Your Support and Rewards

Your support is vital to relocating what is arguably an important piece of early 21st century art. 

  • I need to raise $3,000 (USD); that said more is always better.
  •  $2,700 will be used to fabricate the modular steel frames to support the panels.
  • Balance of $300 is needed to dismantle and transport to local storage.
  • Noteworthy Perks include signed prints, and one of four portions of the moquette. 

The Impact

Your help will insure that the art remains preserved until arrangements for permanent display are concluded.

  • As a contributor, you are directly involved in assisting preservation and relocation of a major work of art.
  • Your efforts directly impact continued enjoyment of an important and poignant painting

If You Can't Donate Funds

I realize that not everyone that loves art and creativity have expendable funds. If you like what you see but can't afford to give dollars:

  • Please refer me to people that appreciate art and can make a donation.
  • Please use Indiegogo Share Tools!

Truly appreciate the time you took to read my plea and if you made it this far, take a look at the Perks!

story:
Breve reseña - brief description

Mi nombre es Renzo Tubiñez soy de Venezuela, desde hace un par de años me he interesado en las bjds, he experimentando, creado e imitado algunas marcas para lograr crear mi propia marca pero actualmente no cuento con le dinero para hacerlo ya que en mi país es imposible conseguir resinas u otros objetos para bjd.
Creare un web cuando cuente con alguna parte de los fondos.
My name is Renzo Tubinez i'm from Venezuela, since a couple of years ago I became interested in the bjds, i experiencing, created and imitated some brands to establish my own brand but currently i don't have you money to do so since in my country it is impossible to get resins or other objects for bjd.

I will create a web when count with some portion of the funds.

Lo que necesitamos y lo que obtienes -
What I need and what you get

  • 100 $ will be used to buy bjd eyes
  • 100 $ to buy watercolor pencils for makeups
  • 300 $ will be used to purchase doll clothes for two Limited Edition 
  • 300 $ will be used to purchase resin
  • 500 $ will be used to the shipping cost
  • 500 $ for market research
  • 200 $ for your rewards
You get a 40cm bjd or another model developed to measure of the term

El impacto - Hit

tener una marca (artista) que quiere hacer su producción lo más económicamente posible ayuda, ya que tienen un producto más accesible para su pleno disfrute.

have a brand (artist) who wants to make its production the most economically possible helps you, since they will have a product more accessible for their full enjoyment.

Riesgos y desafíos - risks

el único riesgo posible es que sus bjd se rompan durante un envió, es poco probable ya que siempre estarán bien empaquetadas.

the only possible risk is that their bjd are broken during a sent, it is unlikely that they will always be well packed.

Otras formas en las que puedes ayudar - Other ways in which you can help

  • pídele a la gente que difunda tu campaña y que genere eco.
  • ask people to spread your campaign and to generate eco.
  •  use las herramientas para compartir de Indiegogo.
  • Use the tools to share

story:
HUIS CLOS

WHAT WE STAND FOR

HUIS CLOS believes that it should be easy for passionate creatives to access the materials, time, space and support they need in order to explore and showcase their ideas.

We also believe that interdisciplinary collaboration is the best way to engage emerging artists and inspire the creation of innovative new works. 

HOW WE WORK

We provide free communal rehearsal space and materials for all collaborators to rehearse and create their pieces.  

We also organise, promote and fund the exhibition or performance of each piece made through HUIS CLOS.  

WHO WE HELP

Jewellery makers, painters, musicians, sculptors, graphic designers, dancers, photographers, film makers, actors, architects, writers, ceramicists, dramaturges; Creatives of all disciplines are invited to participate!

We particularly encourage collaborations between creatives that may not usually work together, for example a ceramicist and a dancer, or a computer programmer, a sculptor and a composer. 

HUIS CLOS is an advocate of democratic collaboration.  Throughout HUIS CLOS, we ensure that each artist has equal artistic ownership over the creation they have contributed to. 

OUR AIMS

- To CONNECT emerging artists from all creative backgrounds.

- To SUPPORT the creative process by relieving the financial and organisational    pressure that tends to accompany it.

- To SHOWCASE pieces developed by collaborating creatives.

- To PROMOTE interdisciplinary collaboration as an effective method of establishing greater communication between different art forms. 

- To INSPIRE emerging creatives to further their artistic development. 

HOW WE WILL USE YOUR MONEY 

- Payment for creation and exhibition space throughout 2015 and 2016.

- Promotion and advertisement of the work created.

- Payment of our website designer and graphic designer.

- To give each collaboration group an allowance for materials during HUIS CLOS Autumn 2015 and Spring 2016.

RISKS

We are now unable to personally fund HUIS CLOS, as we have in the past.  So the only real risk is that, without further funding, HUIS CLOS will be unable to continue! 

We are passionate about our role in connecting, supporting and inspiring emerging artists and hope we will be able to continue to provide a much needed support system for London’s creatives.  

Thank you for taking the time to read HUIS CLOS’ INDIEGOGO!

Beatrix Joyce, Deborah Gaugerenques and Elinor Lewis

HUIS CLOS

For further information, do not hesitate to email us at:

collective@huisclos.org.uk

For more information concerning HUIS CLOS' work go to:

https://www.huisclos.org.uk 

Or check out our Facebook page:

https://www.facebook.com/huiscloslondon

HUIS CLOS
WHAT WE STAND FOR

HUIS CLOS believes that it should be easy for passionate creatives to access the materials, time, space and support they need in order to explore and showcase their ideas.
We also believe that interdisciplinary collaboration is the best way to engage emerging artists and inspire the creation of innovative new works. 
HOW WE WORK
We provide free communal rehearsal space and materials for all collaborators to rehearse and create their pieces.  
We also organise, promote and fund the exhibition or performance of each piece made through HUIS CLOS.  

WHO WE HELP
Jewellery makers, painters, musicians, sculptors, graphic designers, dancers, photographers, film makers, actors, architects, writers, ceramicists, dramaturges; Creatives of all disciplines are invited to participate!

story:
The Story

My name is Joshua Hinson though most people know me as Lakey. I'm a street artist from Austin, Texas that travels all over the country sharing my art, inspiring strangers, and protesting the hindering stereotypes of American culture and counter culture without having to say a word. I wear a suit and tie every day then sit quietly and draw beside an open suitcase holding my portfolio and a cardboard sign saying "Grandma says I need a job wearing a suit and tie...this is my compromise."

I've had my sign called a gimmick in the past, however I think of it as a multi faceted tool. I get to make the suit and tie business men ponder if they pawned off their passion for monetary security, I get to show artists that being a sell out isn't about the clothes you wear it's about the actions you do, and hopefully I inspire a beggar or protester, to be the change they beg for. Every time someone is curious enough to approach me on the street they are an inspiration to everyone who wouldn't dare talk to a "street" person. 

Over the past three years I've traveled over 20,000 miles doing this and Chicago's been my favorite city so I plan on spending the majority of the summer there. I will be bouncing all over the Midwest but Chicago will be the main spot. I will be looking to get involved in the art scene, connect with some good grass root non-profits to volunteer for, and find a place to stay. 

The Needs

With all the rain over the past few months I haven't gotten to set up near as much which means I'm not in the financial spot I'm used to being in when I hit the road. While I'm thankful for a donation of any size I'd like to use this as an opportunity to hook you up with the best deals I've ever offered so make sure to claim your perks!
  • Prismacolor & Molotow Markers
  • 11x17inch Portfolio 9x12inch Portfolio
  • Frames, tables, lights, other supplies to have a good pop up presentation at art shows
  • Bus and train tickets

The Impact

I'll be out 8-14 hours per day creating art and trying to inspire people on the streets and soon as I find a good grass roots non-profit organization focused on inspiring homeless people and impoverished children.

Other Ways You Can Help

Even without being able to give a donation you can be a huge help by simply spreading the word! You can spread the word about this campaign, my Instagram @Lakeythe, facebook.com/LakeythePoet, or the new artist social media website http://onpingo.com/joshuahinson

story:
SERAZARD. Art Straight from the City.

Serazard is a young movement in the New York City art scene formed by photographers inspired by the art and technique behind storytelling.

The website officially launched in January 6th, 2015, and has since supported contemporary artists of all kinds by publishing and promoting their projects.

With a steadily growing audience, Serazard's goal to connect the contemporary art world with new age media is gradually becoming a reality.

  • Who is Serazard?
  • Check out Serazard.

Get Out the Way, Ai Weiwei...

‘FUCK’ the Exhibition is an exclusive, invite-only, fine art exhibition featuring an international cast of artists residing and working in New York City. Each artist will express their interpretation of the word, ‘fuck’, through limited edition diptych photographs. The event will accommodate artists, collectors, media outlets, and enthusiasts from around the world with the highest quality presentation. Our goal is to showcase a new exciting art movement to surface in the photographic art scene in New York.
So get out the way, Ai Weiwei, cuz “‘FUCK’ – the Exhibition” is all we gotta say.
  • Our Event Page
  • The Artists
  • The Amazing Venue

GOAL! -Assist Us!

Our Goal is to reach $2000 to buy materials and hire staff for the event.

  • The Art: Paper, Printing, Frames
  • The Venue: Paint, Boards, Lights, Wine, Food
  • Advertising: Flyers, Stickers, Post Cards
  • Humans: to help us build and run the event!

OH, the Joy of Young Art!

We are in the brink of a new era, where everyone is a photographer. Take a snap with your phone, put a filter on, and viola! you got 1000’s of hits. And they ask why go to art school? Well, to be a writer, all you need is a pen and a piece of paper, but a couple of witty phrases will not make you Oscar Wilde.

Serazard is a gathering of young hopes and dreams. We came and met in New York City, the mecca for Art, with the determination of creating truly unique pieces. We are serious about our craft, and Like Queen Scheherazade, our inspiration to tell stories is a matter of life or death. As the saying goes in the neighbourhood of Bedstuy…it’s Do or Die. (Hashtag that shit #doordie)

EVERY $100 - A Video!

As you can tell by our promo video, we are quite the lovable bunch, not shy of dancing our butts off in front of the camera. But did you know we have other talents, too? Arturo is a mean beatboxer, Atanacio, an amazing painter, Patricia can hit high vocal ranges (although Ninat is the best singer), and Kan...well, Kan is a freakin' wild card. 

Every $100 we collect on the way to our goal, expect an awesome video response from one of the artists showing off some of their talents!

CONNECT with us!

Here are some other ways to contribute!

  • LIKE us on Facebook
  • SHARE our story with your family and friends!
  • SEND us letters of encouragement!

story:
Fulfilling a life long passion of creating an alternative look to

the traditional Ouija board.

The Ouija board came straight out of the American 19th century obsession with spiritualism. 

In 1891, a Pittsburgh toy and novelty shop, started advertising: “Ouija, the Wonderful Talking Board,”  which went on to describe a magical device that answered questions “about the past, present and future with marvelous accuracy”,  "a link between the known and unknown, the material and immaterial.” Another advertisement declared it “Proven at Patent Office before it was allowed.”

Little has changed in the way of design for that board, patented over 120 years ago. A flat wood grain looking board with the letters of the alphabet arrayed in two semi-circles above the numbers 0 through 9 all printed in black which makes it a basic two colour piece; the words “yes” and “no” in the uppermost corners, “goodbye” at the bottom; the planchette is a teardrop-shaped device, comes with it and is used to travel over the board and stopping at a letter or a number, when the connection with a spirit has been made.


Two or more people take part placing their finger tips on the planchette, pose a question, and follow the planchette as it moves from letter to letter.

My name is Shara Ross a career graphic designer, artist and writer.  I love design, creating and writing and am thankful that I can create art for a living.  I became fascinated with Ouija Boards when I was in my teens when my girlfriends and I used it to speak to her deceased cousin. I don’t know who we ended up speaking to but I know it was someone..... or something.... and it ended up spinning the plaquered on the board so quickly it left the board entirely! Since then I have always loved what the board represents. A possible link to that which is beyond our scope of reality, a portal through which communication is possible. I do believe in life after life and I believe you can talk to those who have passed on. 

The Ouija board gained a sinister reputation after the movie called 'The Exorcist' implied the character played by Linda Blair became possessed by a demon after using one. Before that, it was more of a fun game meant and played by the whole family. It became associated with evil because of movie hysteria. That doesn't mean to say you can't invite negative spirits to talk to you. But imagine all the millions of people who have used Ouija boards, and continue to do so to this day. If it was a means for spirits to possess you, we'd have a lot of demonic like people wandering the earth. Just saying. :)

I felt inspired to create new boards. I always thought it would end up being a Tarot deck I would do first, a long standing passion of mine as well, but what started out as a pet project grew into the three boards shown here.... as I've always thought that the Ouija board deserved more than the very generic design it has displayed almost since it's inception.

I’ve created a series of Soul Gate Boards. The first three designs are the feature boards in this campaign and as of yet the only designs thus far. If there is interest, I will continue to do more.

The first design is titled PORTAL. 

It signifies a gateway or a ‘portal’ to connect the user with the other side. It’s the most traditional of the three, more in line with the traditional Ouija Boards.


The second board is called CAROUSEL.

Sometimes life can feel like it is a continuous ride of ‘ups and downs’. As if you’re on perpetual carousel. We all want to get a glimpse of where the next ‘up’ is going to lead us, or when the next ‘down’ is coming. We consult the board for a little helpful insights, or to say hi to a loved one, or even just for the thrill.



The third board is named SYMBOLS. 

It features the drawing of The Vitruvian Man by Leonardo Da Vinci, positioned on a pentagram. Man’s position inside the metaphysical. How appropriate I thought, for a Ouija Board. There is the “Les reines de France” by A.Celliez ed. Lehuby in 1851 France which represents the female aspect of humanity, and a symbol of ‘building your life’ with the architectural drawing on the left.
The medallion underneath symbolizing the perfection of geometry, in an ancient, perfectly proportioned drawn vine.


The line will continue with new designs after this series, that is if there is enough people who love it enough to help. Thanks to you in advance. Your contribution is an inspiration!

THE CAMPAIGN DEETS!

In order to make these boards I'm looking for some seed money to get them produced. I also want to try out different substrates, like glass. Either way, start up money is required and indiegogo is a great platform to see which ones are favored and to get feedback and generate interest.


$6,000 in order to cover production costs.  Here's a breakdown:

Fees from IndieGogo, Paypal (3%) and Credit Cards (3%)
Cost of fulfilling perks (prints, shipping, third party vendors, packaging, etc. costs are a large portion of the amount were asking)
Third party vendors required to complete the production of the boards
If we meet our goal, anything extra will be used to go into the production of new designs. 
YOU WILL RECEIVE YOUR PERK GUARANTEED goal met or not!

Can't share financially? That's OK - you can help us by spreading the word to your friends and around the web. I'm kinda lousy at it, that whole social media thing.

PERKS

$10.00 - Embrace the essence of Soul Gate with this personal greeting postcard of PORTAL and fortune told as selected for you personally by our own Soul Gate spirit guide.  You’ll also receive our heartfelt website recognition thank you.
Postcard example - PORTAL

STICKER AND MAGNET

$25.00 Gets your name listed on our website and on our Facebook page with a big fat THANK YOU! and a mailed sticker and matching magnet with your choice of board design. Size of both sticker and magnets are 5" x 3.5" sticker (Symbols and Portal). Carousel is 5" x 4 3/8".


Glass Boards

I love these simply as unique art. You can back light them, or use them as Ouija's. The glass surface protects the design, which is reversed printed underneath. If you place the boards on a white surface while using them you can see them clearly. 

Celebrate the birth of Soul Gate Spirit Boards with an exclusive limited edition glass Soul Gate Board design of either PORTAL or CAROUSEL. These timeless editions are individually produced and numbered, limited to just 175 each. They are simply exquisite. You’ll also be welcomed to take part in the Soul Gate Message Board Project as well as receive our heartfelt website recognition thank you.


Here is a video showing the board against a window, on an easel.

Glass Eye Planchette's

These perks are very limited. Only 2 per board. The glass eyes are antique, and real. They can sell alone for up to $120.00. The wood planchette has been carved out to house the eye, and a lid built around it. The effect of the glassy eye gives the piece a whole other dimension in fun. Like you're being watched by the board!!!
Your choice of Portal, Symbols or Carousel board design and sensational hand crafted “all seeing eye” planchette. This one-of-a-kind planchette feature and authentic antique glass eye embedded within to help guide your spirit journey. You’ll also be welcomed to take part in the Soul Gate Message Board Project as well as our heartfelt website recognition thank you.

The Soul Gate Getaway

Enter and Immerse yourself within the spiritual context of Soul Gate!

Experience first hand the magic and spiritual context of the Soul Gate Spirit Boards. Take part in our exclusive Séance Slumber Party in a century old church! You and a friend are personally invited to an incredible weekend and spiritual journey. Your first evening will include a guided tour with ghost hunting equipment of some of the regions most spiritual and active cemeteries. The second evening will feature an exclusive séance with a professional psychic and seer, all being captured on film. Each evening will feature delicious catered dinners and drinks. You will leave with your choice of Soul Gate boards each, an invitation to partake in the Soul Gate Message Board Project and some great transformational memories!
