story:
IMPORTANT NOTE: Prints can be shipped to almost any country worldwide, but there are exceptions. Please check the list of countries where prints can be shipped at the bottom of this page.


                                  

                 


SHORT SUMMARY

My name is Victor. I am a digital nomad. Digital nomads are people who are able to work online while traveling (more information can be found on the bottom of this page). It's a dream come true. I now earn money for my trips through photography. However, my camera was broken as it has exceeded its shutter limit preset by the manufacturer. Therefore, I can no longer create the photographs that make my travels possible. I have enough income to provide me with food, accommodation, and transportation, but not enough to buy new equipment. This is why I'd like to offer prints of my artwork in exchange for your kind contribution. More details about these perks can be found on the right of this page.

All these artworks, which are featured in the gallery section of this campaign, are the result of more than two years of experimentation with the double exposure technique. This technique was invented during the era of film photography. The first images of this kind were created in-camera by exposing film twice without changing the frame. 

I believe in everyone’s unique and natural beauty and I hope to show this through my photographs to the public. Thank you for your support. It is only with your help that I'll be able to get back on my creative path. 



What I Need & What You Get

With great pleasure I would like to share the results of my work, which I hope would let me buy a new camera. The artworks  that I offer you are gallery quality Giclée prints on natural white, matte, ultra smooth, 100% cotton rag, acid and lignin free archival paper using Epson K3 archival inks and custom trimmed with 1"-2" border for framing. As you already know, the technique of double exposure was initially created with film cameras. These days, digital equipment allows users to have more control over the process, but I still value the natural feel in photographs, that can be achieved by minimizing digital manipulations. In these prints, post-production only consisted of combining two images, brightness, contrast and color corrections. In other words, no tools were used that wouldn’t be possible in a dark room. I hope that these prints will add an artistic flair to your interior.

The goal of this project is set to 6000 USD. The breakdown of the cost is as follows:

3000 USD – price of the camera

1500 USD – production of prints

900 USD – shipping costs

300 USD – Indiegogo fees

300 USD – transaction fees



My choice of camera is the Sony A7II and Sony FE 55mm F1.8 lens. These equipment have the power of professional functionality in a more compact size. Small dimensions of this camera are crucial for travel photographers because it is easier to carry and it doesn't attract much attention. It may look like a camera for beginners, but it is truly a powerful and professional tool.

If I'm not able to reach the target amount, the funds raised will be saved until I find a way to collect the rest of the money to purchase the desired equipment.

If I'll collect more than the target amount, all extra funds will go to purchase additional pieces of equipment. First tool in the list is smartphone with good camera for mobile photography.


    


THE IMPACT

After first experimenting with the double exposure technique, I realized that it is also a great tool to show the world the natural beauty of people without applying excessive retouching and manipulations, which highlight the unachievable standards of beauty that is widely used by the commercial world to attract potential customers' attention.

For the past 6 years I've been involved with stock image banks that shaped the visual communication of our time. My artwork is seen by hundreds of thousands of people and could influence people's perceptions. This made me more selective with what I create because images from these banks are seen everywhere such as in shops, billboards, magazines, TV, the Internet, and the list goes on.

The double exposure technique is one of the upcoming trends these days and I feel that with your support, more wonderful discoveries are still to come.


LINKS

My portfolio from one of the agencies:

http://www.shutterstock.com/g/tondee

Article about double exposure technique with my artworks published by that agency:

http://www.shutterstock.com/blog/dramatic-double-exposures-that-blend-portraiture-and-nature-photography



HOW TO CHOOSE THE PRINT

I offer you a selection of 16 different prints. They can be found in the gallery of this campaign. All images are numbered. At the end of the campaign I will send you a message to ask which piece you would like. You can order more than one print as well by choosing multiple perks.

If you've chosen «digital image» perk, then I will ask your e-mail address where it can be sent.



DIGITAL NOMADISM

We hear the term “digital nomadism” more frequently in this day and age.  Digital nomads are people who are able to work online while traveling. This is an emerging culture and gaining more interest as tools and technologies such as crowdfunding continue to evolve. That is bringing exciting changes to our society. A professional can now have his or her entire office in one backpack. Tools are more and more compact and Internet technologies are advancing each year. This offers independence to many people who now are able to design their own lifestyles.

Being digital nomad definitely opens many doors. It offers freedom and allows for experimentation and control of all aspects of our lives including food, medicine, business and housing. Many people are used to their lifestyles and routines. However cultures of the world are very diverse and traveling provides an opportunity to exchange knowledge and share your culture. Travelers experiment with alternative lifestyles and are willing to share their discoveries, which benefit people from all over the world. I’m excited to find points where different cultures meet. We accomplish and learn from each other. We are one.

I’ve sacrificed almost everything in pursuit of my dream to travel. In my backpack you’ll find a few days worth of clothes, documents, and most of space is packed with equipment. Luckily nowadays laptop, smartphone and camera are enough. So I’m inviting you to help me fill the empty space that occurred due to my camera breakage.



RISKS AND CHALLENGES

Production of prints, quality and shipping process have been tested already.  In case an artwork arrives damaged by fault of the printing company, please do let me know and I will contact them directly.



IMPORTANT NOTE: Prints can be shipped to almost any country worldwide, but there are exceptions. Please check the list of countries where prints can be shipped:

story:
Ya mero. Where I am at. (english below)

Hola QUERIDAS Y QUERIDOS! Bueno, por ahora me encuentro en este lugarcito en el bosque, inicialmente por razones ligadas a la situación política y social actual ardiente de Mexico. Después de tener que dejar Cholula, y estar en la realidad del exilio, ahora me desprendo y comprendo que mi rol en todo esto,  tiene tintes musicales. Comparto mi voz entorno a lo que para mi sigue siendo importante, razones para las cuales debo insistir en: la comunidad, la familia, la tierra, las tradiciones, el maíz, los ancestros, el amor, y  las artes. En esta ocasión, comparto también  mi respeto, mi indignación, mis esperanzas múltiples, mi canto desde el corazón. Ofrendo este canto a favor de que nos reconozcamos como comunidades de poder. Que volteemos a ver lo que YA estamos co-creando y tejiendo en nuestras comunidades. Celebremos. Reconozcamos, Re-conectemos. Vamos a recordarnos cómo recordar. Mi familia se levanta en Mexico, en Estados Unidos en todo el mundo! Y vamos sonriendo y coloridos! Gracias por confiar en esta ofrenda!
........
Hey dearest ones. Well, for now I am in this place in the forest, initially for reasons tied to the flaming political and social situation in Mexico. After having to leave my city Cholula, and confronting political exile, I now release myself from that to understand my role in all of this, and it is a musical role. I share my voice around subjects that I still find relevant and will continue to insist upon: community, family, the earth, traditions, corn, ancestry, love and the arts. In this moment through this music I will share my respect,  my multiple hopes, my song from the heart. I offer this music in favor of recognizing ourselves as powerful communities. May it assist in us seeing that we are already INDEED co-creating and weaving our communities. Let us celebrate. Let us recognize, reconnect. Let us Remember to Remember. My family is rising in Mexico, in the USA, and in all the world! We are rising and we are rainbow colored-bred (bread) :))) Thank you for trusting this offering!


Que se requiere y que le toca a Ud. (what is needed what you recieve)

Estos donativos van concretamente a financiar la produccion y post-produccion de la primera propuesta de 13 canciones de SUCULIMA. Los gastos son para reunir al equipo de MEX y Estados Unidos para consolidar el album digital, y mil copias físicas de estas 13 composiciones, el diseño, y elaboración de 3 videos musicales y 4 conciertos en Toledo, Oakland, Cholula y (uno por definirse). Este dinero nos apoya en transporte, gastos de producción, gastos internos, comida, renta, renta de equipo, diseñadores, videoastas, músicos e ingenieros de sonido.  A cambio recibirás la música en 3 videos musicales que se compartirán en diferentes medios y 13 canciones del proyecto SUCULIMA :)))))))) el canto de la mujer torbellino. Revisa los regalitos en los "perks" hay + sorpresas! + bendiciones de mucha mucha gente y ondas de amorrrrrrrts! Necesitamos tu apoyo! 
........
Your donation will go specifically to fund the production and post production of our first musical proposal of 13 songs for the SUCULIMA album. The donations will be used to finance the Mexican and American (from the USA) team to consolidate a digital album and 1,000 physical copies of these 13 compositions, the design, and development of 3 musical videos and 4 concerts that will be held in Toledo, Oakland, Cholula and one more that is yet to be defined) These donations will support our transport, food, rent, equipment rental, design, video, and musical and engineering costs. You will receive, 13 songs from the SUCULIMA album and the music of the tornado woman! :))))))))as well as 3 musical videos. You will also receive thanks yous and blessings from many people as well as LOVE WAVES yoo-hoo!  Remember to check the perks for more options and cool surprises! We need ur help!

......

EL IMPACTO .The Impact

El potencial es enorme. Creo que depende de todos y todas nosotr@s. Creo firmemente en esta música y en mi capacidad de compartirla de manera poderosa, pero no puedo hacerlo sola. Te necesito! Si logramos compartir esto creo que es una oportunidad ENORME que podría inspirar a otros músicos a volcar sus intenciones y talento específicamente en temas de sustentabilidad ambiental, justicia social y del espíritu., temas que son pertinentes para la re-estructura de nuestras sociedades y planeta + generar un sentido de esperanza en momentos que necesitan de nuestra respiración. .... que si creo que la música puede desmantelar las injusticias que están ocurriendo? Definitivamente. 
........
the potential is HUGE, but it depends on all of us. I believe that this music is solid and that I can share it in a powerful way, but I still need your HELP and support. If we share this in a BIG way, than we can inspire other musicians to infuse their intentions and talent specifically into environmentally sustainable issues and social justice and spirit issues. These are the subjects that interest me and I find relevant to restructure our societies and planet and generate HOPE during moments that need us to BREATHE. Do I believe that music can dismantle the injustice that is occurring? Hell yeah!

.........

GRACIAS. Thank you. Pamparios.


Gracias por leer todo este texto. Gracias por escucharme. Gracias por ser mi familia. Gracias por inspirarme. Gracias por ser mi amigo. Gracias por ser mi amiga. Gracias por ser mi amante. Gracias por ser mi enemigo. Gracias por ser mi ayudante. Gracias por protegerme. Gracias por pedir por mi. Gracias por creer en mi. Gracias por tu donativo. Gracias por tu apapacho. Gracias por tu amor. Gracias por tu esfuerzo. Gracias por tus bendiciones. Gracias por tu comida. Gracias por tu trabajo. Gracias por compartirte. Gracias por tu cosecha. Gracias a la vida! Gracias a la muerte!  Gracias Abuelos y Abuelas! Por todas mis relaciones! Esto es por ti!
......
Thank you for reading all of this. Thank your listening. Thank you for being my family. Thank you for inspiring me. Thank you for being my friend. Thank you for being my lover. Thank you for being my enemy. Thank you for being my helper. Thank you for protecting me. Thank you for praying for me. Thank you for  believing in me. Thank you for your donation. Thank you for your embrace. Thank you for your effort. Thank you for your blessings. Thank you for your food. Thank you for your work. Thank you for sharing yourself. Thank you for your harvest. Thank you life! Thank you death! Thank you grandfathers and grandmothers! For all of my relations! This is for you!

story:
Dyslexia: It’s about celebrating difference and diversity

Dyslexic Pathways CIC was set up to break down the barriers to success in education, employment and in everyday life faced by dyslexics everywhere.

Our message is dyslexia represents the diversity inherent in humanity and we want to define dyslexia by what we can do and do well. The idea behind this crowd funding is to enable the 6 million dyslexics in the UK, the 66 million dyslexics in the USA and the nearly one billion dyslexics across the world to self advocate for a better deal for dyslexics everywhere, to start developing a coherent community and social movement as well as to raise awareness of a more positive profile of dyslexia.

Our Unique Dyslexic crowd funding campaign is seeking to raise funds to enable dyslexics across the world to advocate for a more positive profile of dyslexia for themselves. This is going to be done by printing and selling tee shirts with positive message logos about dyslexia that we have designed. The funds from this crowd funding will be used to do this to sell more tee shirts and to enable us to work towards Dyslexic Pathways CIC other goals.

Designs used will be selected by our social media followers. We will also be running a little competition for children under 16 years old. This will be to design a dyslexia logo for a tee shirt one that has a positive message. The winner will be selected by our social media followers.

Personally I have a very positive attitude towards my own dyslexia. This was not always so though. I know from my own personal experience and from other dyslexics I talk to that dyslexia can be a real pain. Our experiences of being dyslexic can impact our self esteem and confidence and can leave us feeling like failures. I do not see dyslexia as a disability but as a difference that represents the diversity inherent within humanity. It is society that disables us and this disabling begins in school where we are not taught be teachers who are trained to work with us in an inclusive learning environment.

But we can succeed I think we have to remember the world be poorer place were not for the creative talents of dyslexic, visionaries, entrepreneurs, architects, artists, inventers or writers etc? 

I founded Dyslexic Pathways Community Interest Company in 2009 it is a social enterprise. The main objective is to support and enable people with dyslexia to unlock their potential. Dyslexia Pathways CIC was the first dyslexia focussed social enterprise to be constituted in the world.  We have supported over 400 dyslexic students at universities here in Scotland supporting them on their degree and post graduate degree courses. We also work with individuals and organisations as well as on a couple of groups at the Scottish Parliament.

In 2014 we ran our Unique Dyslexic Get Creative campaign which was all about promoting and celebrating dyslexic creativity and raising awareness of the social model of dyslexia. It was about getting dyslexics together, having fun creatively, and sharing their stories of being dyslexic and rebuilding self esteem and self confidence.  We reached out dyslexics locally here in Fife and central Scotland but throughout the world. 50 people attended of five free creative workshops on visual art, music creating fused glass art etc. We have over 580 likes on our Facebook page over 3000 thousand dyslexics across the would follow our social media

Most recently Dyslexic Pathways CIC held the “Unique Dyslexic: Get Creative – Celebration of Creativity”. Here we exhibited the work done by participants at the workshop and artwork from creative dyslexics from across the world. Dyslexic entertainers such as dyslexic poet Anita Govan provided our audience with brilliant entertainment. The feedback provided for the Unique Dyslexic programme and the Festival of Creativity was extremely positive. Over 60 people attended the event and 15 volunteers helped us to make it a success.

This is part of a larger fundraising effort to diversify and grow as an organisation. Dyslexia Pathways CIC is planning to open a new dyslexia centre to support dyslexics in Fife and across the world It’s an ambitious project but I believe we have the team and support to achieve our goal. This is the start of a social movement that will raise awareness of our more positive vision of dyslexia.

message logos about dyslexia that we have designed. The funds from this crowd funding
will be used to do this to sell more tee shirts and to enable us to work
towards Dyslexic Pathways CIC other goals. 
Designs
used will be selected by our social media followers. We will also be running a
little competition for children under 16 years old. This will be to design a
dyslexia logo for a tee shirt one that has a positive message. The winner will
be selected by our social media followers.
Personally
I have a very positive attitude towards my own dyslexia. This was not always so
though. I know from my own personal experience and from other dyslexics I talk
to that dyslexia can be a real pain. Our experiences of being dyslexic can
impact our self esteem and confidence and can leave us feeling like failures. I
do not see dyslexia as a disability but as a difference that represents the
diversity inherent within humanity. It is society that disables us and this
disabling begins in school where we are not taught be teachers who are trained
to work with us in an inclusive learning environment. 
But we
can succeed I think we have to remember the world be poorer place were not for
the creative talents of dyslexic, visionaries, entrepreneurs, architects,
artists, inventers or writers etc? 
I founded
Dyslexic Pathways Community Interest Company in 2009 it is a social
enterprise. The main objective is to support and enable people with dyslexia to
unlock their potential. Dyslexia Pathways CIC was the first dyslexia
focussed social enterprise to be constituted in the world.  We have supported
over 400 dyslexic students at universities here in Scotland supporting them on
their degree and post graduate degree courses. We also work with individuals
and organisations as well as on a couple of groups at the Scottish Parliament.
In 2014
we ran our Unique Dyslexic Get Creative campaign which was all about promoting
and celebrating dyslexic creativity and raising awareness of the social model
of dyslexia. It was about getting dyslexics together, having fun creatively, and
sharing their stories of being dyslexic and rebuilding self esteem and self
confidence.  We reached out dyslexics
locally here in Fife and central Scotland but throughout the world. 50 people
attended of five free creative workshops on visual art, music creating fused
glass art etc. We have over 580 likes on our Facebook page over 3000 thousand
dyslexics across the would follow our social media
Most recently
Dyslexic Pathways CIC held the “Unique Dyslexic: Get Creative – Celebration of
Creativity”. Here we exhibited the work done by participants at the
workshop and artwork from creative dyslexics from across the world. Dyslexic
entertainers such as dyslexic poet Anita Govan provided our audience with
brilliant entertainment. The feedback provided for the Unique Dyslexic
programme and the Festival of Creativity was extremely positive. Over 60 people
attended the event and 15 volunteers helped us to make it a success.
This is
part of a larger fundraising effort to diversify and grow as an organisation.
Dyslexia Pathways CIC is planning to open a new dyslexia centre to support
dyslexics in Fife and across the world It’s an ambitious project but I believe
we have the team and support to achieve our goal. This is the start of a social
movement that will raise awareness of our more positive vision of
dyslexia.

story:
In a nutshell. Different – in a Good Way.

Fine Art by Burack is F.A.B. and a fun, new way to shop for and gift collectable fine art prints – by design.

F.A.B. is a Bespoke Fine Art Gallery that offers superbly produced, archival quality fine art, photography and limited edition prints made to order exactly as you like. We offer an incredible choice of image styles and the images we offer are available in over 5,000 frame, size and material options.

F.A.B. limited edition prints are all original work by me, Mark Nicholas Burack – each has been photographed, transformed, printed, hand signed and hand numbered . Each comes with a signed Certificate of Authenticity. Even ordering the image you want here is a fun and unique experience where you can communicate directly with me and my team by phone, text or email.

We offer a unique Art gifting experience - gifting F.A.B. Gift Certificates is a fun way to gift fine art because both the gifter and giftee can each choose the image they love - and order it exactly the way they want it. 

Biz Plan - at a glance.

Our Business Plan is a straightforward, organic one that will leverage the money we raise here to invest in the marketing and resources needed to open 6 retail Art Gallery locations in the US and Canada and a Gallery Showroom/Production Space needed to supercharge the 1st year growth of our business in our five sales channels which include:

  1. Online sales to individual collectors.
  2. Gifting - F.A.B. Gift Certificates are great “little luxury” gifts.
  3. “Trade” business for professional designers and decorators by area.
  4. Launching our first 6 partner F.A.B. Art Galleries in the US and Canada within existing luxury retail stores.
  5. Contract services to fundraising organizations to photograph fine art print collections to generate fundraising and donations for our Clients.

For those already familiar with the Fine Art Print business our business model has been developed over the last 12 months and combines a lot of the best traits of the two most successful business models in our Industry .  Specifically it is my intention to offer Peter Lik level quality, highly collectable fine art prints and superb production levels at Yellow Korner level prices. To do that we have developed an exclusive production process that allows us to make signed fine art prints to order.

A Thank You! and an Invitation.

On a personal note I want to thank each and every one of you, ahead of time, for visiting and supporting our Indiegogo Campaign. My Team and I are excited to share our real passion for what we do - and we invite each of you to become part of the F.A.B. Collector Community.

I have included a number of samples of my reality based images in the Campaign so you get good feel for the wide range of image styles we offer in Collections like “Shades of Gray”, “Trashy Manikins” and “Cottage Country”. 

A Commitment to "Pay it Forward".

Taking a more personal and caring approach to business and leveraging our  services to benefit fundraising organizations and charities by generating new funding, gifts and donations for our clients is important to me.  If you are in the fundraising business please check out the Perk we offer here and the Section below called "Doing Good Stuff- Fine Art for Fundraising and Profit Programs" - if you know someone in fundraising please send them this link.

A little background…

In the last 10 years my focus has been developing my skills as a Professional Photographer in the Toronto area and  I have spent the last 10 months exclusively getting ready to launch this business and this campaign – I am driven and I love what I do.

Your Input Welcome.

I've  developed the wide variety of styles of images and collections we currently offer. Over the next 3 months the “Work” section of our site will  be greatly expanded from the current approx. 225 images to 500 by listening carefully to all of you around the world and the images you select for your Perk. I believe a key success factor to business is listening to your clients and I embrace  the challenge of expanding my “repertoire” and growing Artistically with input from those who love my work enough to invest in it.

Why Crowd Fund?

In my view, the Fine Art Print/Gallery business really does not have an equivalent nationally known brand in North America at this time – except perhaps in lower end “decorative art” sources we really don’t compete with. My point is F.A.B is structured and designed from launch to become the highest growth online and retail Art business of it’s type. A  key part of that strategy is using a proven luxury branded business model which I created with my advisors based on 20+ years of experience with my family run luxury retail business that reached $900 Million in revenues worldwide and had 60+ luxury stores operating in the most expensive retail locations in the US and Canada. 

It’s about the Art.

My reality based art creates a truly different Art selection process for the collectors who like my work and want original signed art on their walls. It allows you to choose the image you love, sized it to fit the  space you have in mind and then print it on the material or frame it exactly as you like (just like professional Decorators do).

One of the things that fascinates me spiritually and creatively when I create my reality based art is the “transformation” stage which can result in  radical changes to the original image or very subtle textures and new details that can only be seen when you get close to the print. My images reproduce with high definition detail  and rich, bold color whether they are 10 inches wide or 10 feet wide. For example in my image Empire State View I - shown below- in larger sizes you can count the people walking on the sidewalk and see brake lights on the taxis!

Viewing Art online kinda sucks.

It may not be obvious but I think it is important to point out that though viewing my Art online is the best way to select the image you want the limitations of today’s Internet/display technology is 72 PPI (pixels per inch) so online images kind of suck in comparison to the Fine Art Prints we offer which are printed at 400 DPI (dots per inch). 

Shopping for F.A.B Fine Art online is a  cool experience and FUN -  it allows you to relax in your comfy spot, see a lot of images in a short period of time, compare images and truly appreciate the composition and statement that each image represents.

The Biz and Concepts – “The facts and nothing but the facts.”

The following Sections overview Fine Art by Burack Product line, Services and Use of Funds for those who want to know more.

The Bespoke Gallery for collectors, control freaks and those who love to decorate.

As each F.A.B. fine art print is custom made to your order by the artist (me, Mark Nicholas Burack) you can order exactly the image you want, in the size you want and the material or framing style you want- we offer over 200 images, in 20 themed galleries in 5,000 different combinations right now. You can even order a One-of-a-Kind version of the image you like that will never be replicated and is a Limited Edition of 1. Ordering is easy, fun and we offer a more personal level of service - you can communicate directly with me and my team by phone, text or email. 

F.A.B. Product Line Highlights.

Fine Art by Burack original, signed and numbered fine art prints are available in 5 mediums and vary from ready to frame, archival quality fine art paper 16" x 20" prints to our largest listed signed and numbered 72”/6 ft. wide Gallery Acrylic. If you are not familiar with any of the materials we offer just call me and  we can discuss.

Gallery Matted Prints. 16” x 20” acid free, bevel matt size with precut opening designed to fit into 16” x 20” retail framing. Includes 16” x 20” backing board, protective clear sleeve and F.A.B. Certificate of Authenticity. Gallery Matted Prints. 16” x 20” acid free, bevel matt size with precut opening designed to fit into 16” x 20” retail framing. Includes 16” x 20” backing board, protective clear sleeve and F.A.B. Certificate of Authenticity.

Fine Art Paper Prints. Best choice if you want to frame your image you way. Print size = image size with at least a 1” border for framing. We use acid free, archival quality fine art paper printed one at a time with the best fine art printers, typically at 400 DPI resolution for superb results. Typically shipped or delivered in protective tubes and F.A.B. Certificate of Authenticity.

Gallery Canvas. Excellent choice for larger size prints, relatively light weight and ready to hang. Premium fine art canvas stretched over handmade, 1.5” solid wood frame with protective UV laminate finish. Includes protective packaging and F.A.B. Certificate of Authenticity. Also available with float frame at added cost.

Gallery Acrylic. Outstanding premium quality Acrylics that enhance vibrant colours, accentuate clear crisp details and add a three dimensional look second to none – they really make a statement. Ready for hanging, available on archival glossy or metallic paper, includes black Sintra backing, 1.5” float frame and F.A.B.. Certificate of Authenticity.

Gallery Metal. A unique look that is only available in specific sizes listed. Ready for hanging fine art print on High Definition metal panel, includes back hanging frame that sits approx. 1.5” off the wall and an F.A.B. Certificate of Authenticity. (Note: cannot be signed and numbered on front panel by the Artist, only the back or Certificate.

Customization Options.

In addition F.A.B. offers a wide range of customization options both for consumers and for Trade clients (i.e. Professional Decorators, Interior Designers, Bespoke Interior Resellers, etc.,) including backlit LED display panels, large scale glass panels with images you can see through, as wallpaper, made in a waterproof  Gallery Canvas material you can hang outdoors, prints made to custom sizes we don’t offer online, custom framing and many more options.

Custom Orders and Commissioned Photography.

In addition F.A.B. also offers custom and commercial services to both regular (private) buyers  and “Trade” (i.e. decorators, designers, large scale buyers for projects like hotels, commercial buildings, etc.) that include discount programs for volume purchases, custom photographic commissions to create custom images/prints for specific clients/locations and we also offer a wide range of production options not listed on the site.

Dream Photography Packages.

An interesting and unique photographic service we offer  is something we call “Dream Photography Packages”. A simple concept - you dream it and together we make it reality – the results of a Dream Photography Package are usually beautiful One-of-a-Kind large scale Mark Nicholas Burack Fine Art Prints that make a very cool personal statement you can share and enjoy forever in your home, cottage or office. These packages are also an amazing gift idea, especially for the person who has everything or as a special treat for yourself (you deserve it). Please note: We offer a great deal on a Dream Photography Package as a Perk here – check it out.

Fabulous F.A.B. Gift Certificates Perks.

This BUY ONE GET TWO FREE F.A.B. Gift Certificate offer is exclusively available here through our Indiegogo Campaign.

Doing Good Stuff - Fine Art for Fundraising and Profit Programs.

In my view, leveraging art to promote your brand or organization can be a stroke of genius for many organizations. Iconic and beautiful Fine Art Prints are a thoughtful and artistic way to promote your School, Sports Team, League, Municipality, Tourist Area, Religious Organization or Hotel and they lend themselves to creating great Art  exhibit events that can help other programs you already have.

My Vision. I love creating these images in partnership with those leading Organizations who want to stand out from the herd. I think it is an excellent way to give back to the world by using my art to generate fundraising and profitable revenues for institutions that give so much to so many.

Use of Funds. Target $100,000 in the 30 day Indiegogo Campaign.

Printing and Computer Equipment - $ 8,200

To increase the number of Fine Art Printers we use, buy print supplies at lower cost in volume and add the PC’s and Back Up Systems we need to increase our ability print/deliver faster and ensure we have excellent back up capabilities.

Fine Art Print Inventory - $9,500

Majority of this cost will be invested in the actual Fine Art Prints we display in our Showroom which will also be used to help retail Partners and to do promotional events.

E-Commerce Web Site - $2,500 Upgrades.

The current web site was designed to be upgraded to offer full e-commerce functions for both fine art print orders and gift certificate programs when we wanted to transition it.

SEO Services - $18,000

To establish both the web site and each of the prints we offer in our target markets in both the US and Canada with a focus in our target retail city markets is a lot of work over a 12 month period so we have a budget of $1500 a month.

Social Media Services - $18,000

Establishing the brand and myself on Social Media will also take a lot of effort – forever! In our first year I have budgeted $1,500 a month to pay for these programs though in this case about half of that will be used in the first 3 months. 

Email Campaigns - $12,000.

We plan to aggressively market by email to “Trade” (professional decorators and interior designers, etc.,) by area and the most cost effective way to do that is by acquiring email lists we can market to.

Promotion/Public Relations - $6,800

We plan to put out weekly press releases on the success we realize through the 1st year Marketing Plan for our brand and our partners – this amount represents the additional costs we need to cover over and above the budget we have now. 

*Facilities - $24,500

We plan to move our current production only operations into a larger leased space that will include a Showroom/Art Gallery for our product line and this cost includes the additional lease cost, furniture, decorations, etc., needed. Please note we will not invest in this option until the marketing we need is done and only if we achieve 100% of our goal as our priority is growth related marketing.

Please note: These amounts represent net new marketing and resources we need to grow at a faster pace than our current budget and resources allow. We have the costs of the team, existing facilities, supplies, equipment, etc., covered with our existing finances and resources but we do also plan to attract individual equity investors in 2015 and when we do so will use those funds to double+ the amounts we spend on marketing for growth over and above funds raised through Indiegogo.

story:
Who are we?

an artist. a photographer. and a shop.

    Born in Bristol, we created The Fifth Wall just over 12 months ago as a platform to promote our passion for art and media. After a year of varied projects, from wall murals and business cards to take-away cups and promotional videos, The Fifth Wall is finally starting to get it's foot in Bristol's creative door. You can check out some examples of our past work here.

    Through the success of these small projects, what was originally a bespoke service has now grown into a small collective of local artists in a similar position to us, with our collection of available works slowly expanding as our contacts grow.

    We have now been given a location to share and consolidate our collections to sell to the public, a fantastic opportunity to expand in the form of a shop & gallery premises in the Redfield area of Bristol, For map and contact info please click here .


    What We Need

    Help us realise our potential. 

    We have the shop and are beginning to accumulate the talented artists needed to fill it, but we're afraid this alone will not be enough. Our personal funds are limited and there are many costs we must cover to ensure our work can continue.

    To see The Fifth Wall Shop succeed we are kindly asking for contributions to ensure we increase public and professional awareness and continue to expand our relationships with Bristol artists.

    All funds raised will be used in the following key areas:

    • Stock - the purchase of additional prints, frames, display racks/cases. The essence of an art gallery.
    • Art Supplies- spray paints, pens, canvases etc. To supply an area of Bristol severely lacking in these essential tools of the trade.
    • Promotion - the most essential factor of marketing will be to expand our team of emerging artists but this will also include publicising our presence and services in Bristol's diverse creative scene.
    • The Customer - improved payment processes, postage supplies, protective equipment. Everything to ensure the customer experience is of the highest standard and as simple as possible.
    • The Shop - rent, maintenence and the general upkeep of The Fifth Wall Shop.


    What You Get

    Utilizing what we do best.

    We are sincerely grateful for any help you can give us, to show our appreciation we are offering perks for your generosity.

    From prints and originals to your very own personalised wall mural, we are offering some fantastic and unique rewards for contributors. Check out what we can give you on the right >>>



    The Impact

    How your contribution will help us.

    If we reach our intended goal of £2,500 we will be able to keep our shop open and running for the next 12 months! With this added security we can spend more time concentrating on The Fifth Wall's main aspirations, to discover and promote new artists in the Bristol area. 

    It can be a daunting task to break out onto the scene, we are looking to build an established platform for astists to promote themselves and collaborate with individuals with similar passions. The list of opportunities are increasing rapidly as we continue to negotiate open gallery nights, joint projects and numerous cafe and bar locations throughout Bristol for our team to display and sell their creations.

    Of course, we understand that successfully reaching our target may not be the case but nethertheless, every penny we do receive we still go towards the areas outlined above. We wont be stopped that easily!



    Other Ways You Can Help

    We understand that some people just can't contribute, but that doesn't mean you can't still help.

    • Help us get the word out about our campaign, make some noise!
    • Use Indiegogo's sharing tools to help us reach out on social media platforms.
    • If you think you know someone who will be interested in contributing or collaborating with us then get them in touch.
    • Follow us on our Facebook and Twitter links below to keep updated with our progress.

story:
Hafa adai from Guam! 

My name is Michelle Pier, and I am a full-time artist born and raised on Guam. The creative arts in general is my passion, and it is my goal to inspire people to reconnect with their own creativity, here on Guam and abroad. Along with original paintings and workshops, I also coordinate many community events, festivals and craft fairs to contribute to the local creative arts industry and to help local entrepreneurs grow and flourish. I've been painting under my business name Creative Indeed for 6 years now, and all this time, my work was created either on the kitchen table (back when I  was a single mom on welfare, homeschooling my two little boys), or now on my easel on the floor in the bedroom I share with my boys at my parents' house in a rural area of southern Guam. 

I am proud to say that my career as a full-time artist here on Guam is steadily growing, and I am now ready to move into an actual art studio! Last year, I was awarded the 2015 Home-Based Business Champion of the Year by the Guam SBA. I'm hoping that I won't qualify for the home-based category this year! ;) 

The Story

At the start of the new year, I painted a Divine Mother piece for myself, as my own sort of "guide" to keep on my wall, to inspire me to live with love, peace and joy, and to remind me that I am on the right path. I put my heart and soul into this painting, and of course, shared it, with the note that it is not for sale. I had more messages about purchasing this painting than any other piece EVER. 

SO, I decided that I would offer a series of Divine Mother paintings, and these would be available for purchase, contributing toward the capital needed to open my own art studio. Your original painting will be unique to your preferences (more about the art below).

Why this is so important:

Opening the Creative Indeed art studio will mean that I can paint MORE, and paint bigger pieces. I LOVE painting large canvases! The energy just magnifies itself, and I feel more freedom to move. I will be able to hold classes, workshops, and mini exhibits in my own space instead of having to accommodate at other establishments. I can keep all my supplies organized in one space, instead of having to transport things back and forth. On a more personal note, it means my boys can open their drawers and closet doors without me having to shift around big canvases blocking the way. 

This will also mean that I can help more people. I can have people come visit me in person, and I can offer my art and creative services to a wider audience. This expansion will ripple out to more people than even I can imagine. 


***Side note about my connection with this painting: My birthday is 12/12/84 at 12:12pm. Needless to say, I have a connection with the #12 by birth. The #12 is also very much connected to divine mother energy. I am not very religious, but I do have a strong connection with my own spirituality, and highly resonate with this energy. The divine mother energy goes by many names, probably most familiar are: Mary, Virigin Mary, Virgin Mother, Our Lady of Peace, Our Lady of Guadalupe, Divine Mercy, Queen of Peace, Black Madonna, Quan Yin, Divine Feminine, Queen of Roses, Our Lady of Lourdes, Blessed Mother, Holy Trinity, Goddess, Mother Nature, etc. This first painting was my own personal version, my image that came through on the canvas. I feel there are many more waiting to be painted. 


My Goal & What You Get for Contributing

The space that I am hoping to lease, is in Hagatña, here on Guam. My goal is to raise $10,000 to cover the first 6 months of expenses (including $1200/mo for rent & utilities, $2800 for initial updates to the space such as painting the walls, installing fixtures and furniture, and buying some basic supplies). I am hoping to avoid having to take out a small business loan to cover the rest of the expansion (marketing, promotions, payroll, and the rest of the year's rent), though it may be necessary. 

The space (my boys checking it out):


In return for your contribution, I am offering up unique perks at varying levels in the form of my divine mother art on postcards, greeting cards, prints, AND original paintings on canvas. 


The Perks:

$10- a handwritten thank you on a postcard with the original Divine Mother print shown.

$25- a handwritten thank you on a greeting card with the original Divine Mother print shown, plus one blank one.

$60- a 6"x8" signed & matted print of the original Divine Mother art shown + a handwritten thank you postcard.

$120- an 8"x10" signed AND FRAMED print of the original Divine Mother art shown + a handwritten thank you greeting card.

$190- an 11"x14" ORIGINAL Divine Mother intuitive acrylic painting (you will be contacted after your contribution for your unique image preferences, as it doesn't have to be the same or even similar to the original Divine Mother image shown) on stretched canvas + a handwritten thank you greeting card.

$360- a 16"x20" (same description as above perk)

$490- an 18"x24" (same description as above perk)

$640- a 24"x24" (same description as above perk)

$760- a 24"x30" (same description as above perk)

$980- a 30"x30" (same description as above perk)

$1300- a 30"x40" (same description as above perk)

$3800- a 48"x72" (same description as above perk)


The original paintings on canvas will be done on an intuitive level. I will contact you after you make your contribution (at the end of the campaign), and find out if you'd like to stick with abstract style of my 1st original Divine Mother painting, or if you'd like a little more traditional look interwoven (like specifically Mary, or include roses, or the black crescent that the original Lady of Guadalupe image stands upon, or if you have certain colors in mind for your piece). 

Or you can even commission a totally different image. Paintings will be completed in order of contribution, all to be completed within this year. 

IMPORTANT IF YOU ARE ON GUAM: Shipping fee is added onto the price automatically. If you will be picking up your artwork locally, I will refund the shipping fee. Thank you for understanding. 
If I don't meet the goal of $10,000, any funds raised will still go towards initial rent for leasing the space, it just means I may have to take out a small business loan in addition to funds raised. Of course, all perks will still be fulfilled. 

More about the art

While going for a print may be more budget-friendly (and totally a great start if it's all you can swing right now), there is just no replacement for the texture and energy that comes with an original canvas painting. I started painting abstract pieces on an intuitive level for friends, simply by tuning into their energy and painting whatever I felt for them. It took off and that's what got my art career going in a way I never expected. 

Now, when I do commission paintings, there is still the intuitive element, where I have a basic idea to work with, but I ask that you trust me and where the creative process goes. I have also done commission pieces based on photos (but in my style of course), and it has been so cool to experience my own evolution in my art style and the results of the finished pieces.

Every year, I raise my prices. This is so that I can keep raising the value on my end (buying higher quality supplies, and offering higher quality services and products), and also so that you know your investment is one that will increase in value over the years. Those who bought my paintings years ago could potentially turn around and sell them now for more than twice the amount they purchased them for. I want people to invest in an artwork that speaks to them with emotion and meaning, and know that they are making a potentially long-term investment in themselves, through my artwork. It helps me create more and sustain my livelihood for myself and my children, and it helps you to have a piece that holds a story and value beyond the purchase price. 

Risks & Challenges

I am making the big step to commit to a commercial space. In any business, this is a big risk, and usually a necessary one. As an artist, this means I am asking myself to step up to the next level, to build more consistency and stability through solid systems in my business. I have been building this foundation for about 10 years now, before I even had a business license. I have been developing business systems that work for me and my artist lifestyle. Now it is time to bring this foundation into a physical commercial space.

The biggest challenge will be balancing the transition from working at home to working in a commercial studio space. I believe I can do it, because I've been through many major transitions in the last 10 years, and while each step was scary, I put my all into it, and have pulled it off every time. I have more support than ever now, and my network has grown to a level I never imagined it would. I am involved in several business programs and trainings that hold me accountable to my business goals, values, and services. I am more excited than anything to take on this challenge.

Other Ways You Can Help

You might not be able to make a monetary contribution or invest in an original painting at this time. That is totally okay, I completely understand, as I have been there. What you CAN do is share this campaign, through email, on any social media platforms that you are on, or even through word of mouth. 

Use the share button and help spread the word. You'd be surprised how much this simple act can make a difference! THANK YOU!

story:
Short Summary

I'm an arts writer and stationary artist out of New England. Having lived in the North East, Midwest and sunny California, I am consistently amazed at the diversity and dedication of artists within larger communities. I am setting out on a road trip to explore collectives, communities and activism in the arts from Maine to the Carolinas. My Hyundai and I hope you will be a part of it.

I do what I can to make my experiences yours both through art and a dedicated Instagram and travel blog. I plan to post interviews with various arts activists, summaries of exceptional art spaces, and any small moments along the way. 

What I Need  

I'll be straightforward and hope it doesn't get me flagged or whatnot - I am using this as a venue to sell my art online. I think it's perfect - I make mail, you buy it, I send it. Each piece meets my standards as a work of art in itself. 

Also, you can be content that your money isn't just going to fund my social life, or shopping addiction. This road trip is a professional adventure for me, with a bit of vacation toward the end. Funds go to gas, tolls, AAA. I'll also need stamps, art supplies, and campsites/parking fees.

I assure you I will pay for my own chocolate and coffee, likely to average more than gas and lodging combined. 

What You Get

I have a 35mm camera that I'll be taking with me, sending photo-postcards as Thank Yous after the trip is over. 

My own Reverse Prey illustrations are pre-printed if you'd rather not wait, a project I developed a while ago, and continue to play with. 

My postcards are collaged from found material on recycled cardboard (old BudLight boxes I pulled out of my neighbor's recycling), and will go out halfway through my trip. 

I design pop-up cards to illustrate real places with an idealist twist, also send halfway. 

Each of these will include links to my blog, tumblr and Instagram, so you wont be out of the digital loop. 

If you'd rather buy blanks to send to someone else, I'm definitely open to it. 

The Impact

As someone with a lot of friends in other parts of the country, I like to explore different ways of keeping in touch, especially those that make you sit down and take a second in busy lives. I don't think anything can beat that feeling of anticipation that precedes opening a card or a letter.


My interviews are meant to  explore artistic endeavors down the coast, developing a dialogue between different cultures with similar philosophies. It seems a waste of available technology not to have a free flowing dialogue between artists from all sides of the country. Beyond the people, the natural beauty of North American has been an inspiration to more than just artists for centuries, and I think its crucial to experience it and document as much of it as possible before it changes. 

Risks & Challenges

I don't expect the trip to go perfectly smoothly, but I know really wonderful people all down the coast who will help me out in a pinch. I'm focusing my interviews in places serviced by public transportation, so if I run into car troubles I'll be able to make it to the interviews, even if my return home might be delayed. The biggest challenge will be fitting everyone I want to interview and everything I want to see into the time I have!

Other Ways You Can Help

Please feel free to send me any ideas of shows, artists and especially alternative art spaces to check out during my journey. If I can fit them in I would absolutely love to!

Also, just following my blog and other ways I'm documenting the adventure is great encouragement!

story:
If you've taken the time to watch the video and want to skip to the good stuff- the perks! - the images and details for all the perks can be found at the bottom of this page! 

Simply scroll past the other three headings (About Me, What Is The Eye of the Storm, Why Indiegogo) and peruse the images and descriptions at your leisure ;) If you decide you want to contribute and receive a perk, simply click on the accompanying link to the right side of the screen! Enjoy!


My name is Archer Dougherty, and I’ve been a professional painter for about six years now. I’ve been really lucky; I’ve met and worked with a lot of amazing people, and most of the work I made was for gallery shows, exhibitions, and commissions. But I soon realized working under that kind of pressure for a long time tends to stifle your work and there's no room to experiment, or any freedom to be ok with making bad work!


In 2015, I took the year off gallery shows and spent my time studying, experimenting, and learning to be content when each piece didn’t turn out perfectly. Last year taught me that in order to keep growing as a painter, I need to make a lot of mediocre paintings to get to the good ones, and the few great ones.  It also taught me a lot about myself!

In January of this year, I began a different body of work. Not for a gallery, not for a show - not for anyone but me. I need to make it on my own terms.

                           

                                                             

“Eye of the Storm” is the title of the series of paintings I have begun. Each painting deals with a personally important moment of ‘actuality’. In philosophical terms, actuality is the moment an individual can really only know and observe in truth; it is the moment of present, without the impression of foresight or hindsight. 

Actuality has been described as the spaces between the ticking of a clock, the darkness between the flashes of a lighthouse, the calm in the center of a hurricane; or, the eye of the storm.There is no 'understanding' such as that which comes with foresight and hindsight. These moments simply are.

This last year I discovered things about myself only visible in hindsight - certain concepts which kept resurfacing in my work. These ideas are what I am most interested in exploring: difficulties with religion, the acceptance of death and mortality, the idea of ‘home’ and ‘displacement’, and the very morphous yet impressionable time between dependence and responsibility.

       

Within these concepts there are always moments of profound change. With this body of work, I want to collect these moments from my past and represent them with the calm and clarity offered by seeing them as moments of actuality. Without considering what led to these instances or what change they affected afterwards, these paintings are my interpretation of the moments in the eye of the storm - the hinges of my transition from the person I was into the person I am now. 

                              

There are two very exciting events happening for me this spring, for which I decided to launch this fundraiser: 

  • Conceiving and painting all the work for "Eye of the Storm"
  • Six week painting residency in Assisi, Italy

I can't tell you how wonderful it is to be working on paintings for which there are no outside expectations - just me and my paint and my ideas! This work is so different than anything I have ever attempted before; the ideas are more complex and more personal, the techniques I am using are far more explorative and the sizes are, well....REALLY big!!! The biggest piece I have begun is about five by six feet!

Beginning this body of work is a huge financial commitment - materials are not cheap, and neither is the amount of time spent painting. 


I've already begun the five (or more: I've built five panels!) large scale pieces that will eventually comprise Eye of the Storm. I'm not worrying about shipping them anywhere, about how they will look hanging on a wall, or even what I am going to do with them once they're finished! 
I've built myself a large rolling palette, bought good sturdy brushes of all sizes, and built a few of the panels already. I don't need the funds to begin - I need the funds to finish. Here are some of the main materials I need on an ongoing basis; since it is ongoing, I am unsure how much each category will cost: 
  • Paint
  • Brushes
  • Wood and braces
  • Wax Medium
  • Glazing mediums

Residencies are the overlooked miracles of the art world. They are havens of calm, collectedness, introspection, wonder, culture, and connectivity. They help establish international conversations between art communities, encourage experimentation and growth, promote intercultural learning and advance studio practice and careers. I was lucky enough to attend a painting residency in Sibiu, Romania in the summer of 2014, and the experience changed my life. That experience was why I spent 2015 in such obsessive study, experimentation, and general hermitage....

            

I am going overseas again for a longer period this time, to the art historical center of Europe - Italy! Artistically motivated communities, groups, and individuals who are generous enough to host residencies make it possible for artists like me to travel and experience the world; they are much more reasonable than traveling without, but are not free. 
As with my body of work, I have paid the hosting fee and have been saving for food and materials - but I need help finishing. Here is a breakdown of what I still need for my six weeks in Italy:
  • Airfare: 1600.00 USD
  • Rest of food and materials: 500.00 USD 
  • Extras (such as travel between cities, visiting museums, churches, etc.): 750.00 USD
I have chosen flexible funding because anything helps. These aren't manufacturing or publishing costs - anything you wish to donate will help a great deal in furthering my goals for the spring!

                                                   

As a thank you for everything - even though I couldn't possibly thank you enough for considering donating to support my ventures - I'm offering a variety of artwork to choose from: paper giclee prints editioned and uneditioned, original drawings, paintings, and prints on acrylic. The tiers are broken up into the following sections; if you are interested in a particular section, just scroll to the appropriate heading. 

  • PAPER AND ACRYLIC PRINTS
  • ORIGINAL DRAWINGS AND PRINT COMBINATIONS
  • FRAMED AND LARGER ORIGINAL WORKS

Due to printing, packing, and shipping time and energy, all pieces will be shipped after the campaign has ended :)

*****************
Here are all the tiers in detail - I hope you can find something exciting below! (all dollar amounts are in USD). 
  • 1.00 + -  A great, wonderful thank you! Every little bit helps!
  • 10.00 +  - Exclusive access to my Work and Travel Blog, where you can follow my works in progress and on my adventures in Italy!
(All donations $10.00 and up include access to my blog.) 

I wanted to offer you something you can't get from me all the time. The prints I will be offering - ten images of work ranging from 2010 - 2015 - have never before been reproduced (with the exception of Sandman - which has had one large-size limited edition run), and will never be reproduced again with my permission. A series of five paintings and five drawings that represent the span of my artistic growth and career exclusive to this fundraiser; once the campaign is over, you will never be able to receive prints of these pieces again!
Here are the ten pieces that are available as both acrylic and paper prints, in 5x7" and 8x10" sizes. 
PAINTING SERIES

                                  

The Things She Carries                        Regret                                        Windows

                      

                                        

                     Crushing Down From the Sky                      Sandman

DRAWING SERIES

                 

               Rebirth                              Spotting the Wolf                              Blind

                    

                               

                             Witchdoctor                              Bad Memories

Unlimited Paper Prints
The giclee prints offered in this section are uneditioned - meaning they are unlimited! They will all be signed by me but not numbered. There are two sizes to choose from: 5x7", or 8x10". 
  • 40.00 + - 5x7" giclee archival print, museum quality and hand signed. You will receive one (1) print of one of the 10 images above - please let me know in the comments section if you would like a specific print; otherwise, I will pick one and surprise you!
  • 60.00 + - 8x10" giclee archival print, museum quality and hand signed. You will receive one (1) print of one of the ten images above - please let me know in the comments section if you would like a specific print; otherwise, I will pick one and surprise you!

Limited Edition Paper Prints
The giclee prints offered in this section are limited edition sets. Rather than receiving a single print, you will receive a series of five (5) of either the drawing prints, or the painting prints, or both! These lovely prints will be hand signed and numbered. 
  • 100.00 + - set of 5 limited edition 5x7" giclee archival prints; there will be two separate options to choose either the painting or the drawing series 
  • 250.00 +  - set of 5 limited edition 8x10" giclee archival prints; there will be two separate options to choose either the painting or the drawing series 
Limited Edition Acrylic Prints
Prints mounted with acrylic are a stunning way to display works on paper. They are sturdy, archival, and will arrive at your house ready to hang, floated off the wall about 1.5" or so. They will be signed and numbered on the back. Due to production costs, I am only able offer these in 8x10" sets, instead of singles, in a limited edition format. Be assured, these beauties are so worth the cost!
    

  • 450.00 + - set of 5 limited edition 8x10" acrylic prints, archival and mounted, ready to hang. There will be two separate options to choose either the painting or the drawing series!             

                           

I've made some small multi-media drawings just for this section of the fundraiser! These little pieces range in size from 4x5" to about 5x7" and will arrive loose and unframed. Here is a sample: 

                                                 

These pieces will be chosen and shipped at random to contributors. They are a very limited perk - creating new little drawings is something I consider very special, and I've always enjoyed a great deal, and hope you enjoy them too!
  • 450.00 + - one set of 5 limited edition giclee paper prints, 8x10", signed and numbered, and one original drawing. There will be two separate options to choose either the painting or drawing series of prints!
  • 700.00 + -  super set of all 10 limited edition giclee paper prints, 8x10", signed and numbered, and one original drawing! 

                                  

Here is the section you've all been waiting for! These original pieces might have been made anytime from 2010 to 2013. They will arrive at your doorstep ready to hang on your wall, with a special thank you from me. There aren't many available, and hopefully after this campaign they all will have found new homes!

  • $200.00 

                                           

                                            BLUE HAS BEEN SOLD! THANK YOU!            

            Blue, original drawing, 4x4" matted and framed under glass to 10x12"


                                           

           Green, original drawing, 4x4" matted and framed under glass to 10x12"


                                           

              Red, original drawing, 4x4" matted and framed under glass to 10x12"

  • $375.00

                                         

                           Twilit, charcoal, conte, oil, and gold on panel, 5.5x7.5"



  • $450.00

                                            

                        Lila, oil and graphite on wood panel, 9x12" framed to 11x14"


  • $650.00

                         

                          Are You Here For Me, oil on panel, 14x14" framed to 17x17"


  • $700.00

                                         

                     Spotting the Wolf, conte and charcoal on wood panel, 18x24"


  • $750.00

                                                             

                                            What We Get, oil on wood panel, 6x36"
*************
Thank you all, so much, for taking the time to read through all of this and get to the end :) I hope you find something in this to pique your interest, and find something in this to consider worthwhile! 
Remember, even if you decide not to make a contribution, you can still help me by getting the word out and sharing my campaign! The Indiegogo share tools are located on the left side of the screen, so if you can, show your own friends and family what you have been supporting today. 
Thank you so much from the bottom of my heart, 
Archer
PS - I also want to take the time to thank Bruce Shortz, owner and operator of 10,000 Cranes Studio in Albuquerque, New Mexico, for being so generous with his time and equipment and fabulously dry humor, for helping me make this campaign possible!

story:
Hello everyone, my name is James Trevis and I love football.  I love kicking the ball, juggling the ball and especially running with my team and scoring goals.  This passion for the game has allowed me to be invited to the UK in November 2016 for a Experience of  a Lifetime Tour.  We will be visiting stadiums, watching live games, training with the experts, playing against national youth teams and even get to meet talent scouts from leading clubs!  I am so excited as it really will be the trip of a lifetime!  Which is why I need $10,000.  This will cover the cost of the two-week tour and the materials to cover this fundraiser, I am calling The Graffiti Dream.

To raise the funds for the trip, I am using my art skills in graffiti to create amazing, custom designed shoes for you.  Each shoe will be a unique product so you can have a pair of shoes no-one else has seen or even buy two pair to mix and match.

The shoes will coloured with permanent ink and sealed with clear waterproofing so they last.  My previous  customers love them and I hope you do too!

Thanks so much for supporting my dream and I look forward to sending your shoes, or adding a custom design to your existing shoes.  It is so easy - just select a perk and enjoy!

Warm regards

James

story:
The QB Mission

The Queer Biennial is an international event that champions and invites LGBTQ artists to temporarily step away from white box systems, explore new spaces and connect with new audiences in an unfiltered and organic fashion. Every exhibition or happening is carefully designed to invite participants to engage in a conceptual thread or idea(s). We work closely with an extended groups of artists, curators, and documentarians to expand the vision of this ever-changing, visionary art and curatorial collective. In this way, QB creates ongoing opportunities for queer artists to share our voice and history to the world at large.
You can check out the first Queer Biennial artists and performers here: Catalogue from Queer Biennial I (2014)

Yooth: Loss & Found

This year's second installment titled, Yooth: Loss & Found is focused on the idea of youth and all its permutations. We’re looking closely at how the scourge of the AIDS epidemic influenced artists that came of age during the 1980-90s and a potential bridge or connection to how a new generation of artists reflect (or choose not to reflect) on that lineage of QUEER history. By examining queer youth culture as affected by the AIDS epidemic in relation to modern youth culture, we can shine a light on the true impact of shared history and continued growth within the communities.

What We Need 

The Queer Biennial is looking raise 10k to help fund local and international artists in the community; to empower them to create their work for new platforms and a different kind of visibility. Programming for QBII will include a month-long gallery exhibition in Los Angeles, as well as, a several performance events, an academic series of lectures and public forums and, finally, a literary journal documenting the progress, curation and final product. In this way, QBII not only looks to create inclusive and expansive experiences for audiences, but it hopes to become a current snapshot and ongoing document of this moment in queer history and youth culture.


The Impact

By donating to QB, you're being a part of a queer history, participating in and promoting the continued education of new LGBTQ generations, as well as, the global community. This is a critical time in our story, that requires understanding and outreach across the globe - further than our immediate circles and comfortable bubbles. While in many ways, we are experiencing continued inclusion, there's still many parts of this world where queer people are persecuted. It's vital to look beyond our own lives and promote the art and culture of the queer community, to help bring understanding and progess across borders.

Now is the time!

Right now, our biggest need is funding. Money will allow artists to get paid for their work. Artist advocacy is a prime directive of the Queer Biennial, because we believe that art has the power to change the world. Creating opportunities for expanded viewership, giving a voice to people who have not had one in the past, promoting our shared history as queer people - these are paramount in continued development of QB programming. In addition to funding, volunteer support is key. If you have any interest in our program from a production standpoint, please let us know. We need all hands on deck for the month of June!
story_txt:
The QB Mission The Queer Biennial is an international event that champions and invites LGBTQ artists to temporarily step away from white box systems, explore new spaces and connect with new audiences in an unfiltered and organic fashion. Every exhibition or happening is carefully designed to invite participants to engage in a conceptual thread or idea(s). We work closely with an extended groups of artists, curators, and documentarians to expand the vision of this ever-changing, visionary art and curatorial collective. In this way, QB creates ongoing opportunities for queer artists to share our voice and history to the world at large.You can check out the first Queer Biennial artists and performers here: Catalogue from Queer Biennial I (2014)
Yooth: Loss & Found

This year's second installment titled, Yooth: Loss & Found is focused on the idea of youth and all its permutations. We’re looking closely at how the scourge of the AIDS epidemic influenced artists that came of age during the 1980-90s and a potential bridge or connection to how a new generation of artists reflect (or choose not to reflect) on that lineage of QUEER history. By examining queer youth culture as affected by the AIDS epidemic in relation to modern youth culture, we can shine a light on the true impact of shared history and continued growth within the communities.
  What We Need  The Queer Biennial is looking raise 10k to help fund local and international artists in the community; to empower them to create their work for new platforms and a different kind of visibility. Programming for QBII will include a month-long gallery exhibition in Los Angeles, as well as, a several performance events, an academic series of lectures and public forums and, finally, a literary journal documenting the progress, curation and final product. In this way, QBII not only looks to create inclusive and expansive experiences for audiences, but it hopes to become a current snapshot and ongoing document of this moment in queer history and youth culture.
    
The Impact By donating to QB, you're being a part of a queer history, participating in and promoting the continued education of new LGBTQ generations, as well as, the global community. This is a critical time in our story, that requires understanding and outreach across the globe - further than our immediate circles and comfortable bubbles. While in many ways, we are experiencing continued inclusion, there's still many parts of this world where queer people are persecuted. It's vital to look beyond our own lives and promote the art and culture of the queer community, to help bring understanding and progess across borders.
    Now is the time! Right now, our biggest need is funding. Money will allow artists to get paid for their work. Artist advocacy is a prime directive of the Queer Biennial, because we believe that art has the power to change the world. Creating opportunities for expanded viewership, giving a voice to people who have not had one in the past, promoting our shared history as queer people - these are paramount in continued development of QB programming. In addition to funding, volunteer support is key. If you have any interest in our program from a production standpoint, please let us know. We need all hands on deck for the month of June!

story:
We've also created a poster based on the 3D model. Craving to create something outstanding, we added as much detail as possible. We've created an extremely detailed giclee print



      


 

There are 3 versions of the poster available in our campaign:

- full HD digital version 
- 50cm/53cm (20/21 inch)  size version of the poster.
- a limited 90cm/96cm (35/38inch) size version of the poster. There are only 100 pieces that all come with a quality certificate.




We managed to produce prototypes that we are very pleased with but we need your help to expand the production. We need at least 15400 $ to be able to place a larger order. If you like our product or our idea, support us! In return for your support and trust, you will receive a unique product.

Estimated Delivery Date is June 2016.

 The only possible problem that we can foresee might be delays in production, but we have taken that into consideration when its comes to our proposed delivering timeline. We will hand check every mug for defects to insure you receive the best quality.


        
In 2012, we bought an Ultimaker 3D printer. It took us about a year to familiarize ourselves with all the functions of the device. We were testing how the printer worked with different materials and different sizes of prints. In 2013, we started to move our digital works to the real world and started testing different production processes.


At the end of 2014 we started searching for the perfect solution for the production of ceramics using prototyping in 3D. 2015 was a struggle to make the mug as practical as possible. We were testing various materials – ceramic clay and finally porcelain to be precise. Our goal was to combine ergonomics and looks to create a useful sculpture.

In 2015 we also began to work on the poster. At the end of that year we were able to achieve first satisfactory results – a porcelain, colored mug.


At this point we were confident that our idea, Technocraft, works. 
Was that the end? NO! For a long time we have been working on new designs. Your support will be very helpful to us!








  


-weight:  Big-300g (0.6 lbs); Small- 110g (0.2 lbs)
-size:  Big-11 cm (4.3 in) ; Small- 8 cm (3.1 in)
-capacity:  Big- 500 ml (16.9 oz) ; Small- 150 ml (5 oz)
-material: porcelain

-glazed inside and  mug holder

-microwave and dishwasher safe
-for the lowest weight and overall price, inside of the cup has an irregular shape
-due to the hand made production can occur minor differences in color and form 
-Estimated Delivery Date is June 2016
-If you have any question write to us at:
handmadepixel@handmadepixel.com
