story:
We are honored to be one of 28 guilds chosen from around the world to come out to BRC with an art project that will be constructed right under the man!  Black Rock Participants will use air cannons to blast targets located within the guild space. These targets will be replicas of da Vinci’s military vehicles such as his tanks and ornithopters.

Mobile targets and ornithopters will hang from the ceiling flanked by two beautiful dragons!

The vapor cannons run on air – so is there is an endless supply of ammo!

Imagine an Italian countryside - rolling hills with tanks, cannons and ornithopters dominating the space lit up with LEDs.

Al's coming with us to the playa!  

Check out Al's Plasma Popper!!  Custom built for you with a donation to our guild.

 
Or come away with one of these little pretties:

story:
Thank you, Please Come Again Sponsorship Campaign for Jan Johnson

 

Thank you, Please Come Again is the title for my project and is based on a little red bag from Greece, with particular thread found inside. 

 

Hi, my name is Jan Johnson and thank you for tuning in to hear about my Indiegogo funding campaign. 

 

Your support will help me go to work with these lace-making women in Greece and make a performance with them on the island of Aegina over the course of 3 days.

 

This past year I was a Fulbright Scholar in the United Kingdom and lived in the city of Dundee, Scotland.  My research is in historic needlework and textiles, material and women’s studies and contemporary art practice.

 

As a Fulbright, I traveled with the students and folks that I work with at the university, to Greece for a field study trip and collaborative project. 

 

There, it was my privilege to join with women’s Kopaneli lace-making groups and artists for an evening on Aegina.

 

During our meeting, they made lace and told stories about how they had come to know this skill.   I told my stories and stitched each willing person there to the next and to the next with thread and felt a part of bringing them together for the first time. So from this, I’d like to join with them again in September.

 

Very soon, an exhibition is taking place from the wide array of artists that I came with from Scotland and those that we collaborated with in Greece.   A new space has been renovated for this international exhibition.   I have new work to be installed, and along with this, I have an invitation to return and collaborate with them for a 3-day performance. 

 

Talking with the women, documenting, and listening to the bobbins making their distinctive kopaneli sound, I was able to take in some of the materials and tools, but not the skilled techniques. I did meet many of them and exchanged contact information. 

 

This project is not only my personal research interest, but also my desire to contribute to the community and indirectly the financial situation of these women by encouraging and promoting expertise in this art form.  Your contribution to this research bridges cultural exchange and keeps these traditional forms alive and moving forward.

 

For the upcoming show, I’ve made my own cushion and bobbins. “Oscillation”—the title for the exhibition – is a moving back and forth of ideas, techniques and materials between people and place. What will we make?  We will make a beginning in lace, taken from a drawing, theirs and mine to make something new and contemporary.

 

I hope you will consider the contribution of artists in the fabric of life and lend your support.

 

My goal is to raise $2300 for 6 days of travel and daily expenses, materials and project funds and technical support. 

 

How can you help?  You can help get the word out to interested folks.  Also, I have some unique perks to consider, and many reflect my research and experiences as an American in Aegina and Scotland.

As a featured perk, a $100 contribution will bring a 4-color silkscreen print, 22 x 30 inches, delivered to your door.

For $20, you will receive a personalized hand-written digital print thank you note with a postcard print of my work.

For support with $50,  you will receive a Thank you digital print, OR a jar of homemade lemon honey marmalade with a Scotch whiskey kick. 

A hand-printed etching of the Thank you bag from Aegina will be delivered to you with support of $75. 

Have a ready-to-hang 4-color silkscreen for your wall with a contribution of $250.

In your venue, I will gladly share my research and experience from Aegina and as a Fulbright scholar in Scotland during an afternoon or evening presentation for your group with the help of $350 towards my campaign.

A uniquely hand-painted 4-colour silkscreen is framed and YOURS, delivered to your door and ready for your wall with a $400 contribution.

With a $650 support, your group or organization can enjoy a workshop and presentation in your venue, where I will demonstrate with authentic materials and share my travel and research experiences as a Fulbright Scholar in Greece.

 

Thank You for your time and your support.  And Please Come Again to check out further details and spread the word.

story:
Our Goal 

At the moment BEING is based in an old converted classroom in the Bronson Center. We have been in this beautiful community space for 13 years and have created and grown a lot in that time. We’ve made thousands of drawings and paintings and every cabinet, drawer and surface of our space is packed with art. We are ready to update our studio and get our work out of this room and into the world!

We have built an enormous amount of creative energy and experience over the years and are determined to take things to the next level. We are eager to create and collaborate on an ambitious scale. However we need your help! The $12,000 we are working to raise will help us become a vibrant presence in the arts community locally and beyond. Your donations will work to support a studio that allows us to create the kind of innovative, dynamic work we want to make. Supporting BEING studio will make this dream a possibility and will help shape an inclusive creative community that is open and accessible to all.  

Our Projects

Operations/Materials:

Our artists have been working with the same student-quality paint and canvases for over a decade. We would like to invest in new materials so our artists have the opportunity to individualize their work not only through approach but through material choices. We also currently rely on a single older model computer - an updated computer and equipment such as a scanner, a high volume printer and programs such as indesign and photoshop would allow us to invest in our brand and develop our digital and online presence. Your donations will be able to help us in so many different ways!

The Studio:

Our studio is overflowing with work.  Alterations to the layout of the room would provide artists with the opportunity to work in privacy and experiment with larger canvases. A new paint job and hanging system and better storage facilities will help the studio present as professional and protect artists work from damage.

Applications and Grants:

Your donations will help us allocate the necessary resources to ensure that we can apply to funding sources and grants. In the past we have not had the resources to work on this. We believe an investment in this important area will be returned tenfold.

Shows and Exhibitions:

Our artists deserve to be showcased! Whether it be the participation in or hosting of art shows, or in partnering with respected art galleries, your donations will be used to help our artists exhibit their work and support them in bringing their creations to the public.

Guest Artists and Workshops:

Bringing guest artists into the studio provides our members with the opportunity to work in new ways and consider their work from an alternative perspective. It also creates connections with the arts community and paves the way for lasting relationships between BEING studio artists and other local creatives.

 

Our Awesome Perks: 
 

A $50 donation will receive an  8x 10" print of a work by one of our artists as well as a hand made thank you note. 

A $100 donation will receive a  16x20" print, small original drawing and hand made thank you note from one of our artists. 

A $200  donation will receive  8x 10" and 16x20" prints, an original story and small drawing and a hand made thank you note. 

A $500 donation will receive two  8x 10" and a 16x20" print, an original story and small drawing, a hand made thank you note, and an original painting. 

For more information about our organization, artists and projects you can visit: 

http://www.beingstudio.ca/

Operations/Materials:
Our artists have been working with the same student-quality paint and canvases for over a decade. We would like to invest in new materials so our artists have the opportunity to individualize their work not only through approach but through material choices. We also currently rely on a single older model computer - an updated computer and equipment such as a scanner, a high volume printer and programs such as indesign and photoshop would allow us to invest in our brand and develop our digital and online presence. Your donations will be able to help us in so many different ways!

The Studio:
Our studio is overflowing with work.  Alterations to the layout of the room would provide artists with the opportunity to work in privacy and experiment with larger canvases. A new paint job and hanging system and better storage facilities will help the studio present as professional and protect artists work from damage.
Applications and Grants:
Your donations will help us allocate the necessary resources to ensure that we can apply to funding sources and grants. In the past we have not had the resources to work on this. We believe an investment in this important area will be returned tenfold.
Shows and Exhibitions:
Our artists deserve to be showcased! Whether it be the participation in or hosting of art shows, or in partnering with respected art galleries, your donations will be used to help our artists exhibit their work and support them in bringing their creations to the public.
Guest Artists and Workshops:
Bringing guest artists into the studio provides our members with the opportunity to work in new ways and consider their work from an alternative perspective. It also creates connections with the arts community and paves the way for lasting relationships between BEING studio artists and other local creatives. 
Our Awesome Perks:  
A $50 donation will receive an  8x 10" print of a work by one of our artists as well as a hand made thank you note. 
A $100 donation will receive a  16x20" print, small original drawing and hand made thank you note from one of our artists. 
A $200  donation will receive  8x 10" and 16x20" prints, an original story and small drawing and a hand made thank you note. 
A $500 donation will receive two  8x 10" and a 16x20" print, an original story and small drawing, a hand made thank you note, and an original painting. 
For more information about our organization, artists and projects you can visit: 
http://www.beingstudio.ca/

story:
Short Summary

We are Ad Hoc! We are an intimate show for emerging independent fashion designers. The show is for those who don't have the means just yet to show their work in a unique space.  Designers are chosen to match our detailed aesthetic. 

Rather than a typical runway show, we have models on pedestals in a gallery setting. This makes it possible to see and really appreciate the clothes, over seeing them walk by for a few seconds. 

Music is  a huge inspiration and contribution to Ad Hoc, so we will have live music!

What We Need & What You Get

Due to high demand of Los Angeles space this year, venues have asked for more. Especially seeing that we have successfully filled two venues in previous shows. We are able to provide this show for designers, but we need a little help with the costs as the show has become bigger(a good problem to have). 

If you could even skip your large coffee tomorrow and donate $5, anything is appreciated. If you do donate $20 or more, there are some perks :)

**You can also just donate whatever amount you'd like, minimum is not $20**

The Impact

Ad Hoc is an important piece of the Los Angeles fashion industry because it is trying to be nicer to its tenants(designers) we don't want those who have amazing talent to be hidden. We want to make an event that will get those people where they deserve to be!

Risks & Challenges

So far we have just faced the struggle of rates on venues we need to involve more people, not only as viewers, but for the team of Ad Hoc! We are continuing to grow, and your contribution will help just that. 

Other Ways You Can Help

If you would rather have your coffee, or simply can't contribute in that way, please help us spread the word so we can get this moving! We also would love to see your faces there! So share this with friends and save the date! (Once we have a date)

www.theadhoc.show

@theadhoc

story:
Who are we?

 

IO&U is a group of contemporary jewellery and gemstone artists and recent graduates from the University of Trier in Idar-Oberstein, Germany. We are 12 female emerging artists from 9 different countries from all over the world (Germany, Netherlands, Italy, Latvia, Slovakia, United States of America, Taiwan, Iran, and South Africa). While we come from different cultures, we have formed a strong connection in Idar-Oberstein as artists and friends. While our work differs visually and conceptually, we each push the boundaries of contemporary jewellery with our handmade and unique pieces.

Our work relates to experimental, jewellery-body concepts which focus on the choice of materials in relation to handcraft approaches. With patience, passion, and excitement for these experimental challenges, we move our artistic research forward. Having finishing our studies in 2020, our next step is to share our work with the public.

As artists we believe our work is not just contemporary jewellery, it is an expression of the hidden places within ourselves that we all seek to discover. There is a cycle, initiated by the maker to the object, to the wearer through materials and ideas, involving and connecting different people from all walks of life.

“We open our world to you to share our stories” - IO&U

 

A call for donation

As emerging artists and recent graduates of contemporary jewellery and gemstones at the University of Trier in Idar-Oberstein, Geramany, the heart of the gemstone trade in Europe, rich in history for cutting and mining gemstones, we have finished either our Bachelors or Master’s of Fine Arts degrees. We would like to exhibit our graduation work during Munich Jewellery Week, the largest and most famous contemporary jewellery event in the world. We ask for your support to allow us to travel from Idar-Oberstein, Germany and build a special exhibition with displays that we are making ourselves. We ask for your support to allow us to curate this special exhibition of our graduation work for the first time open to the public. The exhibition will take place at the Lovaas Project Gallery during Munich Jewellery Week on March 11-15, 2020. We invite everyone to attend to see and experience our work first-hand.

We would like to take part during this important event in Germany to represent ourselves and to propose a direct discussion with a wide audience about the contemporary jewellery scene and offer an open discussion about it with the public. The next step transitioning from student to professional is an important, yet difficult one to make alone. We ask for your support to help make our project as impactful and real as we are capable of creating. With all of our strength and passion we want to make our project real. Throughout our journey we will continue to document our process on our Instagram and Facebook pages. Please like and follow us to stay up to date with how we make the most use of your time and donations.

 

A special gift from us

As a thank you for your support, we offer a selection of jewellery our group members have made as well as a variety of of merchandise with illustrations by one of our talented group members, Barborka Opátová. We will send you these personalized gifts by post at the end of the campaign. The selection of these objects is made to emphasize how important your contribution is to us. We also offer the option of a special tour of Idar-Oberstein or dinner in Munich during Munich Jewellery Week for our highest donors. Through this offer our group will get to know you and we can spend a fun day together while experiencing the best of IO&U.

All of the names of our supporters will be written into the "Adventure into IO&U" book to be on display during our exhibition as way for your help to be recognized.

 

*All shipping, internationally and within the EU is 5€ in addition to the donation price listed. International customers are responsible for any duties, VAT, or surcharges levied or charged by their country. All sales are final and returns or exchanges are not possible.

 

Other ways you can help

If you are unable to contribute with a donation, we ask if you could get the word out about what we are doing! We would like to spread our love of making, creating, and discussing the impact of contemporary jewellery with a wide audience. So please, follow, like, and share our video and posts on social media with your friends and family!

 

Find out more about our group and our work on our website: https://www.ioandu.art/

 

Follow us on Instagram: https://www.instagram.com/ioandu_jewellery/

 

Follow us on Facebook: https://www.facebook.com/ioandujewellery/

 

From the bottom of our hearts we say:

Grazie Mille

謝謝

با سپاس

Ďakujem

Dankjewel

Liels Paldies

Thank You

Danke Schön

 

Video Credits

Video Produced, Filmed, Written, and Edited by: Margherita Berselli, Barborka Opátová, Samantha Laddin, and Setareh Shojaee

Featured Book Handmade by: Margherita Berselli, Barborka Opátová, Samantha Laddin, and Setareh Shojaee

Illustrations by: Barborka Opátová

Intro and Outro Music by: Caroline Rose - "Jeannie Becomes A Mom"

Special thanks to Oscar Wippermann for goldsmith tools in set design.

story:
We have closed our online store temporarily to focus on this campaign. Museum has been making fine jewellery, both ready-to-wear and bespoke, for over 11 years and today we are offering a holiday special on all of our pieces seen on www.MSMSTN.com.

All items in the Indiegogo fundamentals collection are unisex, handmade and can be worn in the shower/bath, pool and even in the hot sauna without discolouring, tarnishing or oxidizing! 

We are able to eliminate some of the traditional cost on the consumer end, because all of our product is made in-house either at Dessye's private studio or at our partner facility, Daniel's Launchpad.

So now is your chance to get the perfect gift for yourself or loved ones this Christmas.. what are you waiting for?

Below is our fundamental selection & the rings come with free engraving to make this special gift even more unique and valuable to the wearer.. 

Pledge Now!

 

Chains will go up for sale after we stretch past our $10,000 goal. Other pieces will also be added based on the success of this campaign. 

About Museum

Daniel Dessye, the founder and local maker founded Museum Station to provide a marketplace the average consumer could come to for luxury without the traditional industry markups. 

The name Museum Station was inspired by a train station in Toronto. The African and Native decor stands out amongst all the other stations, but when you look below the surface this station somehow metaphorically represents the way society has hidden the powerful points of our history and instead has chosen to teach of slavery and assimilation in our schools and media. 

Our platform was meant to give a voice to the ones that a hidden and empower and teach others that they too come from greatness. 

This is an invitation to be a part of greatness!

Additional Content

Our book IOU: The Book of Great Artists & our Jewellery-Art Installation 'Ready To Shine' are due 2020 and are also available for pre-sale. The book is a children's bedtime storybook about real-life artists and their life journeys, to inspire the youth to create. The pictures accompanying to stories will be handmade pieces of jewellery, some of which will be on display at our debut installation at Launchpad next year.

 

DELIVERY BEFORE CHRISTMAS!

story:
Introduction

My name is Katalin Pazmandi, I am an installation / performance artist.  The Healers Art Team and I are building a glow in the dark installation at Burning Man  2016. We are well on our way but we are still in need of additional funding.

This interactive installation is a 25' portal to other dimensions, a gate to other worlds.  It is being created with 80% of recycled materials! Participants will be able to experience daytime at night and nighttime during the day.  This will give a sense of each light state being unified, blending dualism and giving those who experience the piece the ability to see both of these states overlapping each other at the same time. This will stimulate the feeling of oneness with the universe. A oneness with the earth and everyone and everything all around them. This is the perfect state to learn compassion and love.

Glow in the dark design on the wings...

 

There are some interactive elements: you can paint your own designs on the wrapped around black wind breaker with glow in the dark paint! It can only happen if we receive enough funding, so it all depends on YOU who will come to the Playa this year! The portal experience can be individual or communal. At daytime, you will experience the sun beams playing with the piece and at night you will be able to experience the glow. The wings will feature the northern star constellations. There will be a shamanistic drum ceremony once a day in the portal that you can also participate in.

Lumenoctis is a low budget art project that is mainly made out of recycled materials, built in a backyard and tried out in a driveway of a small house in Upstate New York. Please support us, we really need your help!

The installation is 25' in diameter, 10' high, using wood, steel, ropes and canvas with intricate psychedelic patterns that glow. The themes of the canvas will be constellations and phosphorescent sunbeam effects. Each will have unique visual aspects that  exhibit different lighting traits through out the day and night.

Please help this project become a reality!

Plan version 3...

What We Need…

The work is ongoing, but to be able to finish and make it happen, we need to:

1. Buy more materials, including wood, fabric, stakes, guy wires, paint, solar generator and miscellaneous supplies that still needed. ~ $3500

and

2. Get a trailer to bring it down from New York to Nevada. ~ $1500


If you support this project you can receive handmade glow in the dark necklace, original glow in the dark artwork, or credit in our promotional materials at Burning Man among other things. Check our perks and see the gallery for samples.

The top piece with the northern hemisphere star constellations in the August sky

The Impact

Please support art that is helping heal people spiritually and mentally! Come by on the Playa and paint your own luminescent designs on the black wind breaker that will be wrapped around the entire portal! Check out my website and see more projects I have worked on in the past

KatalinPazmandi.com

Follow recent updates on my Facebook page!


Risks & Challenges

Challenges will arise but my team and I will accomplish the building phase of the project and deliver this unique experience to Burning Man “Davinci’s Workshop” 2016.


Other Ways You Can Help

If you would like to help this installation become a reality Please share my project on Indiegogo and other social media! Please spread the words about it so it will actually happen! 

Thank you for helping us on our path!

Glow in the dark designs on the canvas.

One of the wings with the constellation Aries ready to be painted

The middle bottom piece being welded.

The portal above your head and the constellations.

The part that you will step on still sizzling hot.

Lumenoctis is in the make.

The try out building is happening!
